Titaniam Server REST API Reference

Introduction

Titaniam server includes the following components:

  • Titaniam Encrypted Analytical Vault is a NoSQL datastore. Store your most valuable data and conduct full-featured search analytics while keeping the data encrypted at all times.
  • Titaniam API Translation Service is a translation service. It allows you to encrypt/ decrypt a variety of data (structured, unstructured, binaries). This product can be used independently to secure sensitive data or to translate data released from other Titaniam products.
  • Titaniam Vault’s AWS S3 Endpoints allows to securely write data to S3. It can be deployed either as a restful service or a S3 Proxy.
  • Titaniam Elasticsearch Proxy allows you to securely store, retrieve, and search data in an Elasticsearch index.

This document is aimed at users who intend to encrypt, decrypt, and search data using Titaniam Suite of Products. At the end of this document, you will be able to successfully

  1. Store, retrieve and search data in the Titaniam Vault using its REST APIs.
  2. Encrypt and decrypt data using the Titaniam API service.
  3. Encrypt and decrypt data stored in AWS S3.

You can also search for data and render the results in a clear, masked, or encrypted format.

Hosts

The REST API allows you to interact with Vault using HTTP requests. The primary host for Vault and Titaniam for S3 is referred to as: {Spectra_URL:8080} or {{secureStoreURL}}. The primary host for the API translation service is referred to as {pantherURL:8080}.

Format

The Titaniam Server APIs use JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Some endpoints take the parameters as a body in the request and some endpoints use the query methods. The individual endpoints describe how you must specify the parameters.

Authentication

Mutual TLS OR Client-Side Cert authentication is required before accessing the APIs. For more information about setting up TLS authentication, see this document.

Titaniam Server supports OAuth authenication based single sign-on (SSO). You must supply the token generated by your SSO server as the Authorization bearer token. For information on how to set up SSO, see this document.

Authorization

You can prevent the Titaniam services from accidental or abusive access by securing the endpoints with token-based authorization. It involves the following steps:

  1. Set up the authorization token when deploying the Titaniam service. If you have not already configured the authorization token, see this document .
  2. Specify the authorization token x-tn-access-key in the header along with the API request.

Error Handling

A 2xx status code in the response indicates success. A 4xx status code in the response indicates failure. A description of the error is returned in the response body.

Translation Service

Titaniam Translation Service is a translation service. It allows you to encrypt/ decrypt a variety of data (structured, unstructured, binaries). This product can be used independently to secure sensitive data or to translate data released from other Titaniam services.

Encode and Decode Individual Data

Use the APIs in this section to encode and decode individual data. The following data is supported:

  • aes
  • ff1_alphanumeric
  • ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak
  • ff1_numeric
  • ff1_numeric_no_tweak
  • ff1_printable_ascii

aes

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decypt the input data using the AES algorithm.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{pantherURL}}/aes/encrypt?dedup={true|false} Encrypt the input data
POST {{pantherURL}}/aes/decrypt?dedup={true|false} Decrypt the input data

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the encryption is successful or not.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: SUCCESS indicates that the encryption was successful.
  • result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data.

aes_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt a document using the AES alogrithm.

When you encrypt a token, you can choose to perform a deduplication operation or not. When you deduplicate, the redundant data is eliminated, that is, for the following input: ["input": ["CVE-2077-1514", "CVE-2077-1514"], only one result is returned: ["CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk"]

When you do not deduplicate, the redundant data is treated as separate inputs, that is, the following input: ["input": ["CVE-2077-1514", "CVE-2077-1514"] returns something similar to the following:

{
   "CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk"
},
{
   "CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdQAAAGGWiJY9s/70H7AzM8L0Q/DmZ2rNM8gJEXg"
}

Query Parameters

You must include the following query parameter in the request.

Parameter Values Description
dedup true (default), false Use this parameter to enable or disable deduplication of data. When true, deduplication is enabled. When false, deduplication is disabled.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": ["CVE-2077-1514", "CVE-2077-1514"]
}' "{{IPaddress}}/aes/encrypt?dedup=false"
POST %7B%7BIPaddress%7D%7D/aes/encrypt?dedup=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{

    "input": ["CVE-2077-1514", "CVE-2077-1514"]

}
  • aes_encrypt_dedup_true
  • aes_encrypt_dedup_false
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 16 Feb 2023 12:10:15 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdIAAAGGWiHhdM/70H6zBWHtzRIHnQcWqhXEuZn7"
    }
}
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 16 Feb 2023 12:10:45 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk"
        },
        {
            "CVE-2077-1514": "AQAAAdQAAAGGWiJY9s/70H7AzM8L0Q/DmZ2rNM8gJEXg"
        }
    ]
}

aes_decrypt

Use this request to decrypt strings that have been encoded using an AES alogrithm.

When you decrypt a token, you can choose to perform a deduplication operation or not. When you deduplicate, the redundant data is eliminated, that is, for the following input: ["input": ["AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk", "AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk"], only one result is returned: ["AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk": "CVE-2077-1514"]

When you do not deduplicate, the redundant data is treated as separate inputs, that is, the following input: ["AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk", "AQAAAdMAAAGGWiJY9s/70H63K5F3WOpxfbRpEqFTG5xk"] returns something similar to the following:

{
  "AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS": "CVE-2077-1514"
},
{
  "AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS": "CVE-2077-1514"
}

Query Parameters

You must include the following query parameter in the request.

Parameter Values Description
dedup true (default), false Use this parameter to enable or disable deduplication of data. When true, deduplication is enabled. When false, deduplication is disabled.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{

    "input": ["AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS"]

}' "{{IPaddress}}/aes/decrypt"
POST %7B%7BIPaddress%7D%7D/aes/decrypt HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{

    "input": ["AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS"]

}
  • aes_decrypt_dedup_true
  • aes_decrypt_dedup_false
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 16 Feb 2023 12:16:13 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS": "CVE-2077-1514"
    }
}
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 16 Feb 2023 12:16:35 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS": "CVE-2077-1514"
        },
        {
            "AQAAAXpYD3+Pz/vQfgAAAITerTcRL6KvLwGXiGYAPTeS": "CVE-2077-1514"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_alphanumeric

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decrypt an alphanumeric string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Query Parameter

You can specify the following query endpoint with this endpoint:

Parameter Required Supported Values Description
verbose Optional true, false(default) When verbose is true, the response includes the input as well. For example, {"value":"028 50 8889", "start":0, "end":8, "formatting_characters": "-", "input": "123-45-6789"}
When verbose if false, the response includes only the encrypted value. For example, {"value":"028 50 8889", "start":0, "end":8, "formatting_characters": "-" }

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Parameter Required Supported Values
input Mandatory
The input field includes nested fields: value, formatting_characters, start, and end. The rest of this table describes these fields.
value Mandatory Value to tangle using FPE. Value can include alphabets, numerals, and other characters. Note that except alphabets and numerals other characters are not tangled. Instead these characters are used as salt during encryption.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters are retained in the output and are also not used as Salt when encrypting the data. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.
Note: You cannot specify any characters from the alphanumeric character set.
start Optional This field specifies the start index field of the value. The translation service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0. If you specify this field, you must also specify the index end field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
end Optional This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt Encrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt?verbose=true Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt?verbose=false Encrypt an alphanumeric string. However, note that the response does not return the input values. Only the encrypted values are returned.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/decrypt Decrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/decrypt?verbose=true Decrypt an alphanumeric string. The input value is retuned in the response.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/decrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/decrypt.Decrypt an alphanumeric string. However, note that the response does not include return the input values. Only the decrypted values are returned.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

* code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful . The code for this endpoint returns as 200 OK even if there are errors in the individual input field. For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned.
* result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data. When the query parameter verbose=true, the input fields are also returned in the result. When verbose=false, the input parameters are not returned in the result.
* message: For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned as follows:

code Description
INVALID_START_END_VALUES The start and end values mentioned in the input are invalid. Ensure that start and end are positive values, start >=0, and start < end.
ERROR The input includes characters that are no allowed.
UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE One or more parameters types are incorrect. The supported parameter types are: value, formatting_characters, start, end.
INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS A parameters has an incorrect value.
REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER A required parameter is not specified in the input. For example, value.

ff1_alphanumeric_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt an alphanumeric string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encoding (fpe). If you intend to encrypt only a number using FPE, use the ff1_numeric endpoint.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234/5678",
            "formatting_characters": "/",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-12345678",
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-98765-4321",
            "start": 0
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-2222-1234567",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "test1234-5678"
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_alphanumeric/encrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234/5678",
            "formatting_characters": "/",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-12345678",
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-98765-4321",
            "start": 0
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-2222-1234567",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "test1234-5678"
        }
    ]
}
  • ff1_alphanumeric_encrypt_verbose_false
  • ff1_alphanumeric_encrypt_true
  • ff1_alphanumeric_encrypt_error

ff1_alphanumeric_decrypt

Use this request to decrypt alphanumeric strings that have been encoded using a FIPS-compliant FPE algorithm.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9,
            "value": "HaB-A8Ge-AAb8"
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=true"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=true HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9,
            "value": "HaB-A8Ge-AAb8"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decrypt an alphanumeric string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported.

How is ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Different from ff1_alphanumeric Endpoint?

In ff1_alphanumeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the formatting characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Query Parameter

You can specify the following query endpoint with this endpoint:

Parameter Required Supported Values Description
verbose Optional true, false (default) When verbose is true, the response includes the input as well. For example, {"value":"028 50 8889", "start":0, "end":8, "formatting_characters": "-", "input": "123-45-6789"}
When verbose if false, the response includes only the encrypted value. For example, {"value":"028 50 8889", "start":0, "end":8, "formatting_characters": "-" }

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Parameter Required Supported Values
input Mandatory
The input field includes nested fields: value, formatting_chars, start, and end. The rest of this table describes these fields.
value Mandatory Value to tangle using FPE. Value can include alphabets, numerals, and other characters. Note that except alphabets and numerals other characters are not tangled. Instead these characters are used as salt during encryption.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters are retained in the output and are also not used as Salt when encrypting the data. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.
Note: You cannot specify any characters from the alphanumeric character set.
start Optional This field specifies the start index field of the value. The translation service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0. If you specify this field, you must also specify the index end field.
end Optional This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt Encrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=true Encrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE. The response includes the input values as well.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt. Encrypt an alphanumeric string. However, note that the response does not include return the input values. Only the encrypted values are returned.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt Decrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=true Decrypt an alphanumeric string. The inputs values are returned in the response.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt . Decrypt an alphanumeric string. However, note that the response does not include return the input values. Only the decrypted values are returned.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

* code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful . The code for this endpoint returns as 200 OK even if there are errors in the individual input field. For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned.
* result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data. When the query parameter verbose=true, the input fields are also returned in the result. When verbose=false, the input parameters are not returned in the result.
* message: For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned as follows:

code Description
INVALID_START_END_VALUES The start and end values mentioned in the input are invalid. Ensure that start and end are positive values, start >=0, and start < end.
ERROR The input includes characters that are no allowed.
UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE One or more parameters types are incorrect. The supported parameter types are: value, formatting_characters, start, end.
INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS A parameters has an incorrect value.
REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER A required parameter is not specified in the input. For example, value.

ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt an alphanumeric string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encoding (fpe). If you intend to encrypt only a number using FPE, use the ff1_numeric endpoint.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-5678",
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-12345678",
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "end": 9
        },
                {
            "value": "CVE123412345678",
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-98765-4321",
            "start": 0
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-2222-1234567",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "test1234-5678"
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-5678",
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-1234-12345678",
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "end": 9
        },
                {
            "value": "CVE123412345678",
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-98765-4321",
            "start": 0
        },
        {
            "value": "CVE-2222-1234567",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "value": "test1234-5678"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak_decrypt

Use this request to decrypt alphanumeric strings that have been encoded using a FIPS-compliant FPE alogrithm.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9,
            "value": "eWy-qgqh-8bf8"
        },
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "end": 9,
            "value": "qtq-J2fS-yWr45678"
        },
        {
            "value": "qtqJ2fSyWr45678",
            "end": 9
        },
        {
            "start": 0,
            "value": "2Do-ZQacO-MKiC"
        },
        {
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9,
            "value": "WqD-JVyN-7234567"
        },
        {
            "value": "At5MLcH8-F9Ch"
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=true"

        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "end": 9,

        },

            "value": "At5MLcH8-F9Ch"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_numeric

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decrypt a numeric using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Query Parameter

You can specify the following query endpoint with this endpoint:

Parameter Required Supported Values Description
verbose Optional true, false (default) When verbose is true, the response includes the input as well. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-", "input":"*643-8*"}].
When verbose if false, the response includes only the encrypted value. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-"}].

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Parameter Required Supported Values
input Mandatory
The input field includes nested fields: value, formatting_characters, start, and end. The rest of this table describes these fields.
value Mandatory Value to tangle using FPE. Value can include numerals and other characters. Note that except numerals other characters are not tangled. Instead these characters are used as salt during encryption.
Values greater than 1 billion must be specified as strings.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters are retained in the output and are also not used as Salt when encrypting the data. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.
Note: You cannot specify any characters from the numeric character set.
start Optional This field specifies the start index field of the value. The translation service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0. If you specify this field, you must also specify the index end field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
end Optional This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt Encrypt a numeric using FPE. This endpoint is the equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt?verbose=false
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt?verbose=true Encrypt a numeric using FPE. Whenverbose=true, the response includes the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt. Encrypt a numeric using FPE. Whenverbose=false, response does not include the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt Decrypt a numeric using FPE. This endpoint is the equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt?verbose=false
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt?verbose=true Decrypt a numeric using FPE. When verbose=true, the response includes the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt. Decrypt a numeric using FPE. When verbose=false, the response does not include the input.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

* code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful . The code for this endpoint returns as 200 OK even if there are errors in the individual input field. For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned.
* result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data. When the query parameter verbose=true, the input fields are also returned in the result. When verbose=false, the input parameters are not returned in the result.
* message: For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned as follows:

code Description
INVALID_START_END_VALUES The start and end values mentioned in the input are invalid. Ensure that start and end are positive values, start >=0, and start < end.
ERROR The input includes characters that are no allowed.
UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE One or more parameters types are incorrect. The supported parameter types are: value, formatting_characters, start, end.
INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS A parameters has an incorrect value.
REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER A required parameter is not specified in the input. For example, value.

ff1_numeric_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt a numeric using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encoding (fpe). If you intend to encrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE, use the ff1_alphanumeric endpoint.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [{
        "value": "*123-6*",
        "formatting_characters": "-*",
        "start":0,
        "end":2
    }]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_numeric/encrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [{
        "value": "*123-6*",
        "formatting_characters": "-*",
        "start":0,
        "end":2
    }]
}
  • ff1_numeric_encrypt_verbose_false
  • ff1_numeric_encrypt_verbose_true
  • ff1_numeric_encrypt_error

            "start": 0,
            "end": 2,
            "value": "*983-6*"
        }
    ]
}

    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "start": 0,
            "end": 2,
            "value": "test"
        },
        {
            "start": 0,
            "end": 2,
            "value": "*643-6*"
        },
        {
            "code": "INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS",
            "message": "Invalid keys [[formatting_characters]] in parameters"
        },
        {
            "code": "REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER",
            "message": "Required key [value] in parameter"
        },
        {
            "code": "INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS",
            "message": "Invalid keys [[formatting_characters]] in parameters"
        },
        {
            "code": "REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER",
            "message": "Required key [value] in parameter"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_numeric _decrypt

Use this request to decrypt numerals in a document that has been encoded using a FPE alogrithm.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [{
        "value": "*643-6*",
        "formatting_characters": "*-",
        "start":0,
        "end":2
    }]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt?verbose=true"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_numeric/decrypt?verbose=true HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [{
        "value": "*643-6*",
        "formatting_characters": "*-",
        "start":0,
        "end":2
    }]
}

  • ff1_numeric _decrypt_verbose_true
  • ff1_numeric _decrypt_error

    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "code": "INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS",
            "message": "Invalid keys [[formatting_characters]] in parameters",
            "input": {
                "value": "-test---12kdsf",
                "formatting_characters": "-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 9.9999999999999999999999e+22
            }

            "message": "Required key [value] in parameter",
            "input": {
                "formatting_characters": "-/",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            }
        },
        {
            "code": "INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS",
            "message": "Invalid keys [[formatting_characters]] in parameters",
            "input": {
                "value": "titaniam---/12kdsf",
                "formatting_characters": "-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 9
            }
        },
        {
            "code": "UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE",
            "message": "Unsupported type for parameters [[value]]",
            "input": {
                "value": {
                    "type": "test"
                },
                "start": 0
            }
        },
        {
            "code": "INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS",
            "message": "Invalid keys [[invalid]] in parameters",
            "input": {
                "value": "test",
                "invalid": "key",
                "start": 0
            }
        },
        {
            "start": 0,
            "input": "encryption---/12kdsf",
            "end": 9,
            "value": "encryption---/12kdsf"
        },
        {
            "start": 0,
            "input": "-encrypted-titaniam---/12kdsf",
            "end": 9,
            "value": "-encrypted-titaniam---/12kdsf"
        },
        {
            "value": "titaniam-test---/60kdsf",
            "input": "titaniam-test---/12kdsf"
        },
        {
            "value": "-titaniam-test---/24kdsf",
            "input": "-titaniam-test---/12kdsf"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_numeric_no_tweak

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decrypt a numeric using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9.

How is ff1_numeric_no_tweak Different from ff1_numeric Endpoint?

In ff1_numeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Query Parameter

You can specify the following query endpoint with this endpoint:

Parameter Required Supported Values Description
verbose Optional true, false (default) When verbose is true, the response includes the input as well. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-", "input":"*643-8*"}].
When verbose if false, the response includes only the encrypted value. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-"}].

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Parameter Required Supported Values
input Mandatory The input field includes nested fields: value, formatting_characters, start, and end. The rest of this table describes these fields.
value Mandatory Value to tangle using FPE. Value can include numerals and other characters. Note that except numerals other characters are not tangled. Values greater than 1 billion must be specified as strings.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters are retained in the output and are also not used as Salt when encrypting the data. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.
Note: You cannot specify any characters from the numeric character set.
start Optional This field specifies the start index field of the value. The translation service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0. If you specify this field, you must also specify the index end field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
end Optional This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt Encrypt a numeric using FPE. This endpoint is the equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=true Encrypt a numeric using FPE. Whenverbose=true, the response includes the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt. Encrypt a numeric using FPE. Whenverbose=false, response does not include the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt Decrypt a numeric using FPE. This endpoint is the equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=false
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=true Decrypt a numeric using FPE. When verbose=true, the response includes the input.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt. Decrypt a numeric using FPE. When verbose=false, the response does not include the input.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

* code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful . The code for this endpoint returns as 200 OK even if there are errors in the individual input field. For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned.
* result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data. When the query parameter verbose=true, the input fields are also returned in the result. When verbose=false, the input parameters are not returned in the result.
* message: For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned as follows:

code Description
INVALID_START_END_VALUES The start and end values mentioned in the input are invalid. Ensure that start and end are positive values, start >=0, and start < end.
ERROR The input includes characters that are no allowed.
UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE One or more parameters types are incorrect. The supported parameter types are: value, formatting_characters, start, end.
INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS A parameters has an incorrect value.
REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER A required parameter is not specified in the input. For example, value.

ff1_numeric_no_tweak_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt a numeric using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encoding (fpe). If you intend to encrypt an alphanumeric string using FPE, use the ff1_alphanumeric endpoint.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [{
        "value": "123-123-123",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "-123-123-123",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "-1-2-3-1-2-3-1-2-3",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/encrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [{
        "value": "123-123-123",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "-123-123-123",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "-1-2-3-1-2-3-1-2-3",
        "formatting_characters": "-",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    }
    ]
}

ff1_numeric _no_tweak_decrypt

Use this request to decrypt numerals in a document that has been encoded using a FPE alogrithm.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "098-402-697"
        },
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "-098-402-697"
        },
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "-0-9-8-4-0-2-6-9-7"
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_numeric_no_tweak/decrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "098-402-697"
        },
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "-098-402-697"
        },
        {
            "formatting_characters": "-",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 10,
            "value": "-0-9-8-4-0-2-6-9-7"
        }
    ]
}

ff1_printable_ascii

Use this endpoint to encrypt or decrypt a printable ASCII characters string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. ASCII characters from 0 to 136 are valid and encrypted. Other ASCII characters are retained.

Format

This request uses JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

Query Parameter

You can specify the following query endpoint with this endpoint:

Parameter Required Supported Values Description
verbose Optional true , false (default) When verbose is true, the response includes the input as well. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-", "input":"*643-8*"}].
When verbose if false, the response includes only the encrypted value. For example, "result": [ {"value"="*123-6*", "start"="0", "end"="2", "formatting_characters": "*-"}].

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Parameter Required Supported Values
input Mandatory
The input field includes nested fields: value, formatting_characters, start, and end. The rest of this table describes these fields.
value Mandatory Value to tangle using FPE. Value can include alphabets, numerals, and other characters. Note that other than ASCII characters between 0 to 136 are not encrypted. Instead these characters are used as salt during encryption.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters are retained in the output and are also not used as Salt when encrypting the data. You can specify up to 10 characters (ascii code 0 to 136) in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.
start Optional This field specifies the start index field of the value. The translation service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0. If you specify this field, you must also specify the index end field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
end Optional This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt Encrypt a printable ASCII string using FPE
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt?verbose=true Encrypt printable ASCII string. The input values is returned in the output.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt. Encrypt printable ASCII string. However, note that the response does not include the input values. Only the encrypted values are returned.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/decrypt Decrypt printable ASCII string using FPE
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/decrypt?verbose=true Decrypt printable ASCII string. However, the response includes the input values.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/decrypt?verbose=false Equivalent of {{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/decrypt. Decrypt printable ASCII string. However, note that the response does not include the input values. Only the decrypted values are returned.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

* code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful . The code for this endpoint returns as 200 OK even if there are errors in the individual input field. For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned.
* result : Specifies the input data and the encrypted or decrypted data. When the query parameter verbose=true, the input fields are also returned in the result. When verbose=false, the input parameters are not returned in the result.
* message: For each individual input field, the code and messages are returned as follows:

code Description
INVALID_START_END_VALUES The start and end values mentioned in the input are invalid. Ensure that start and end are positive values, start >=0, and start < end.
ERROR The input includes characters that are no allowed.
UNSUPPORTED_PARAMETER_TYPE One or more parameters types are incorrect. The supported parameter types are: value, formatting_characters, start, end.
INVALID_PARAMETER_KEYS A parameters has an incorrect value.
REQUIRED_VALUE_IN_PARAMETER A required parameter is not specified in the input. For example, value.

ff1_printable_ascii_encrypt

Use this request to encrypt a printable ASCII string using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encoding (fpe).

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [{
        "value": "test!*",
        "formatting_characters": "*",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "test!",
        "formatting_characters": "",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "test!",
        "formatting_characters": "",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt?verbose=false"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/encrypt?verbose=false HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "input": [{
        "value": "test!*",
        "formatting_characters": "*",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "test!",
        "formatting_characters": "",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    },
    {
        "value": "test!",
        "formatting_characters": "",
        "start":0,
        "end":10
    }
    ]
}

ff1_printable_ascii_decrypt

Use this request to decrypt a printable ASCII string that have been encoded using a FIPS-compliant FPE alogrithm.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": ".sQN[",
            "formatting_characters": "",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        }
    ]
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v2/ff1_printable_ascii/decrypt?verbose=true"

{
    "input": [
        {
            "value": ".sQN[",
            "formatting_characters": "",
            "start": 0,
            "end": 9
        }
    ]

Encode and Decode Documents

A schema is required to encode and decode a document. If you have not defined a schema yet, you must define it before encoding or decoding documents. Use the schema endpoint to create and retrieve schema using the translation service.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Create a schema with the specified schema name and version.
GET {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Retrieve a schema with the specified schema name and version.
DELETE {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Delete a schema with the specified schema name and version.

Create Schema

Create a schema with the specified schema name and version.

POST {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version}

When creating a schema, you must send the schema in the requests payload. The payload must be of the following syntax:

{
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "field_name1": {
                    "type": "data_type"
                },
                "field_name2": {
                    "type": "data_type"
                },
                "field_name2": {
                    "type": "data_type"
                }                
            }
        }
    }

where field_name is the name of the field (it is a string) and the types can be one of the following:

type Description
encrypted_keyword Use to encode the input string using the AES algorithm
tangled_date Use to encode a date.
tangled_keyword Use to encode a keyword.
tangled_keyword2 Use to encode a keyword2.
tangled_integer Use to encode an integer.
tangled_ip IPV4 or IPv6. IPv4 is encoded as a 128-bit number and IPv6 as a 256-bit number (two 128-bit numbers).
ff1_numeric A numeric encryption using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
ff1_numeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_numeric. In ff1_numeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_alphanumeric An alphanumeric string encrypted using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:
ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_alphanumeric. In ff1_alphanumeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_printable_ascii ASCII printable characters from 33 to 126 are considered as part of the input data and are tangled or encrypted. Any ASCII characters that are outside this range and retained.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful or not.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: indicates that the operation was successful.
    • NOT FOUND: indicates that the schema was not found.
  • result : Specifies the input schema.

If you do not provide a schema_version, an error with the 404 code is returned specifying that the schema is not found. schema_version must of the format: x.y where x and y are numbers.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "first_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "last_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "tax_id": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "start_date": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "date_of_birth": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "department": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "street_address": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "city": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "state": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "zip": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "phone": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric"
                },
                "work_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "personal_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "annual_salary": {
                    "type": "clear"
                }
            }
        }
    }' "{{pantherURL}}/schema/example_emp_schema/3.0"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/schema/example_emp_schema/3.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "first_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "last_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "tax_id": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "start_date": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "date_of_birth": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "department": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "street_address": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "city": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "state": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "zip": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "phone": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric"
                },
                "work_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "personal_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "annual_salary": {
                    "type": "clear"
                }
            }
        }
    }
  • Create Schema
  • Create Schema
  • Create Schema
  • Create Schema: Unsuccessful
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositioninline;filename=f.txt
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 21 Sep 2022 03:02:48 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
   "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "first_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "last_name": {
                    "type": "ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "tax_id": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "start_date": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "date_of_birth": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "department": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "street_address": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "city": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "state": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "zip": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "phone": {
                    "type": "ff1_numeric"
                },
                "work_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "personal_email": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                    "formatting_characters": "-",
                    "start": 0,
                    "end": 9
                },
                "annual_salary": {
                    "type": "clear"
                }
            }
        }
    }x
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length72

Connectionclose

    "status": 404,

    "message": "",
    "path": "/schema/example_emp_schema"

Delete Schema

Delete a schema with the specified schema name and version.

DELETE {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version}

PATH Parameters

You must specify the schema_name and schema_version that you want to create or retrieve. These parameters are mandatory.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful or not.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: indicates that the operation was successful.
    • NOT FOUND: indicates that the schema was not found.
  • result : Specifies if the deletion is successful.

If you do not provide an schema_version, an error with the 404 code is returned specifying that the schema is not found. schema_version must of the format: x.y where x and y are numbers.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "first_name": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "last_name": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "tax_id": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "start_date": {
                    "type": "tangled_date"
                },
                "date_of_birth": {
                    "type": "ff1_printable_ascii"
                },
                "department": {
                    "type": "encrypted_keyword"
                },
                "street_address": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "city": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "state": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "zip": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "phone": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "work_email": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "personal_email": {
                    "type": "tangled_keyword"
                },
                "annual_salary": {
                    "type": "tangled_integer"
                },
                "ip": {
                    "type": "tangled_ip"
                }
            }
        }
    }' "{{pantherURL}}/schema/example_emp_schema/1.0"
DELETE %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/schema/example_emp_schema/1.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

Get Schema

Retrieve a schema with the specified schema name and version.

GET {{pantherURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version}

PATH Parameters

You must specify the schema_name and schema_version that you want to create or retrieve. These parameters are mandatory.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation is successful or not.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: indicates that the operation was successful.
    • NOT FOUND: indicates that the schema was not found.
  • result : Specifies the schema.

If you do not provide an schema_version, an error with the 404 code is returned specifying that the schema is not found. schema_version must of the format: x.y where x and y are numbers.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{pantherURL}}/schema/example_emp_schema/3.0"
GET %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/schema/example_emp_schema/3.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

Encode Document

A schema is required to encode JSON document. Use the encode endpoint to encode documents.

Note: If you are a Palo Alto Cortex XSOAR Titaniam Protect content Pack customer, all you need to do is create schemas. The content pack encodes and decodes the documents. Ignore this section.

Format

The translation service APIs use JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{pantherURL}}/encode/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Encode the input file using the specified schema name and version.

Response

If the encoding is successful, the response includes the input fields and the corresponding encoded values.

If the schema is not found, a 404 Error code is returned.

Encode

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '[
     {
        "first_name": "Melvyn",
        "last_name": "Todman",
        "employee_id": "18730",
        "tax_id": "749-20-1445",
        "date_of_birth": "2020-01-03",
        "department": "Heavy Engineering",
        "personal_email": "mtodman0@nbcnews.com",
        "annual_salary": 49643,
        "employee_type": "Fulltime",
        "ipv4": "192.0.2.146",
        "ipv6": "2345:0425:2CA1:0000:0000:0567:5673:23b5"
                
    }]' "{{pantherURL}}/encode/example_emp_schema/3.0"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/encode/example_emp_schema/3.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

[
    {
        "first_name": "Melvyn",
        "last_name": "Todman",
        "employee_id": "18730",
        "tax_id": "749-20-1445",
        "date_of_birth": "2020-01-03",
        "department": "Heavy Engineering",
        "personal_email": "mtodman0@nbcnews.com",
        "annual_salary": 49643,
        "employee_type": "Fulltime",
        "ipv4": "192.0.2.146",
        "ipv6": "2345:0425:2CA1:0000:0000:0567:5673:23b5"
                
    }]

Decode Document

A schema is required to decode JSON document. Use the decode endpoint to decode documents.

Note: If you are a Palo Alto Cortex XSOAR Titaniam Protect content Pack customer, all you need to do is create schemas. The content pack encodes and decodes the documents. Ignore this section.

Format

The translation service APIs use JSON encoded as UTF-8 in the request.

Parameters

The parameters must be passed as a body in the POST method.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{pantherURL}}/decode/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Decode the input file using the specified schema name and version.

Response

If the encoding is successful, the response includes the input encoded values and the corresponding decoded values.

If the schema is not found, a 404 Error code is returned.

Decode

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '[
    {
        "first_name": "MAykEU",
        "last_name": "kt1XXh",
        "employee_id": "18730",
        "tax_id": "774-56-1070",
        "date_of_birth": "WfGjHSNpV4HdXGf8BJbISg==",
        "department": "AQAAAIcAAAGEebDiEhTrrw2M6yAYqAxxhW+fK+ozs2mc4xj63rNwtJSApgDzJN67Ng==",
        "personal_email": "db^`abc]^b`b_e`aa_bfdbdbhcb\\dbe_de]aabcf^bb\\fd$_e``faa]cfa^a]",
        "annual_salary": "49643",
        "employee_type": "Fulltime",
        "ipv4": "192.0.2.146",
        "ipv6": "2345:0425:2CA1:0000:0000:0567:5673:23b5"
    }
]' "{{pantherURL}}/decode/example_emp_schema/3.0"

User-Defined Types

What are User-Defined Types

User-defined types are custom data types that are defined by the programmer and have a specific meaning within the context of the program. These types are created by combining basic character sets (such as numeric, alphanumeric, and printable_ascii) and adding a semantic constraint that restricts the type to only certain values or operations. This helps to enforce better code organization and make the program more self-explanatory. For example, a user-defined type for representing a credit card number might only allow the type to hold numerals of a certain length and sets of numerals separated by - , or a user-defined type for representing a date might only allow the type to be created or modified in a specific way.

You can use the translation service to create your own formats referred to as user-defined types (UDT) from a pool of supported semantic types, and create rules around these UDTs: what are the allowed formatting characters, what is the minimum and maximum lengths, what are the allowed format types: clear, encrypted, ff1_numeric, and so on.

What Operations can you Perform on the UDTs

  • You can create, update, retrieve, and delete UDTs.
  • Translate a UDT from one format to another. Such as from an ff1_numeric to a clear text format.

Understanding the UDT Definition

The UDT definition includes information about the following operations:

Validation

When using the translation service, you might have your input data in a certain format: clear text, tangled, or encrypted. However, the input data is originally a semantic type such as an SSN. The semantic type such as SSN has inherent meaning to the data, such as it is of certain length (for example 16), sets of numerals are separated by -. To retain the implicit meaning of this data during translation, the Translation Service provides you with a set of validation tools:

Valid Character Sets: Translating from one format to another format involves the following steps:

  1. If your input is in encrypted format, decrypt the input data into clear text.
  2. If your output is not in clear format, encrypt the clear text into the output format.

The valid characters sets enforces the validation on the clear text in this process. This is to ensure that the implicit meaning of the UDT is retained. For example, if you specify the valid character set as numeric, the translation service validates that the decrypted data actually includes only numerals. If not, an exception is raised.

Length: The decrypted input data is validated against the specified min_length and max_length.

Formatting Characters

If you want to retain any characters in your semantic data, then you must specify those characters in this field. The formatting characters you can specify depends on the valid_character_set field. If valid_character_set field is numeric or alphanumeric, you cannot specify any characters from these character sets as formatting characters. Examples of invalid formatting characters are:

Invalid input example for Numeric
valid_character_set  : numeric
formatting_characters : "1"
input : "123"

Invalid input example for Alpha Numeric
valid_character_set  : alphanumeric
formatting_characters : "F"
input : "First"

Examples of valid formatting characters:

Valid input example for Numeric
valid_character_set  : numeric
formatting_characters : "-LIN"
input : "LIN-123-456"
Valid input example for Alpha Numeric
valid_character_set  : alphanumeric
formatting_characters : "+"
input : "a+b+1"

When valid_character_set is printable_ascii, allowed formatting characters can contain upto 10 characters from the printable_ascii character set. For example:

Invalid input example for printable ascii
valid_character_set  : printable_ascii
formatting_characters: "¢EAC123456789" //Contains more than 10 characters from the alphabet set excluding ¢
input : "EAC-123-456"
Valid input example for printable ascii
valid_character_set  : printable_ascii
formatting_characters : "+1-CEA"
input : "EAC-123-456"

Formats

The translation service allows you to translate input data to output data. For example, you can translate input data that is in clear text format to an encrypted format. The UDT definition lets you define how the input data is formatted and what are the allowed output formats.

Format Attributes: Attributes are associated with a format. Attributes include rules that define whether a format type can be used as an input or output during translation. start and end attributes that define what parts of the input data is formatted. For example, you can specify a rule that the output data must be masked up to the first four characters.

Transformations

Allowed mappings of input format types to output format types. Transformations essentially let you translate an input format type to another format type. For example, you can pass clear text as input and translate it to a masked format.

How to Use the UDT APIs

  1. Create a definition using the POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{definition_name}/{version} endpoint.
  2. Translate data using the POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{definition_name}/{version}/{fromType}/{toType} endpoint.

or

Translate data using the transformation endpoints POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{definition_name}/{version}/{transformation_name} endpoint.

Quick Reference

The following table lists the supported APIs.

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version} Create an UDT definition
DELETE {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version} Delete an UDT definition
GET {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version} Retrieve an UDT definition
POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{udt_name}/{version}/{fromType}/{toType} Translate input data from one format to another.
POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{udt_name}/{version}/{transformation_name} Alternate endpoint to /v1/udt/translate/{udt_name}/{version}/{fromType}/{toType}.

Create UDT Definition

Use this endpoint to create an UDT definition.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version}

Parameters

You must specify the following parameters in the JSON body of the request.

Field Type Mandatory? Valid Values Description
valid_character_set Mandatory [numeric , alpha_numeric, printable_ascii] Defines the character sets that are allowed in the UDT. numeric is {0 through 9} alpha_numeric character set includes Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) and {0 through 9} printable_ascii includes alpha_numeric and ASCII characters {33 through 126}
max_length Optional (defaults to 0) Unsigned Integer Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the input data when in clear text. The input data can itself be in clear text or another format such as encrypted. When the input data is in a encrypted format, the max_length validation is performed after stripping the formatting characters.
min_length Optional (defaults to 0) Unsigned Integer Defines the minimum number of characters allowed in the UDT. min_length cannot be greater than max_length. The input data can itself be in clear text or another format such as encrypted. When the input data is in a encrypted format, the min_length validation is performed after stripping the formatting characters.
formatting_characters Optional The formatting characters in the input field are retained. These characters are not used as salt when translating the data to an output format.
formats Mandatory See Allowed Format Types Defines the format types. Formats defines type (how the data is formatted).
transformations Optional See Allowed From Types and Allowed To Types Defines transformations from one format to another.

Allowed Format Types

The following table lists the allowed format types and their attributes.

Format Type Description
clear The data is in clear text.
encrypted_keyword The data is in an AES-encrypted format.
tangled_keyword The data is in an encrypted format generated using a proprietary algorithm from Titaniam.
masked The data is masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: start: This field specifies the start index field.The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the data has an index 0. The start attribute defaults to 0. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked. mask_character: Titaniam Translation Service will use this character to mask the value. You can specify only one character as a mask_character. For example, if you specify *, value is displayed as *. is_allowed_input specifies if this format can be used as an input. is_allowed_output specifies if this format can be used as an output during translations.
Note: The masked type cannot be used as an input type. The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
ff1_numeric A numeric encryption using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This format preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:
start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.
end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
is_allowed_input specifies if this type can be used as an input. is_allowed_output specifies if this type can be used as an output during translations. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
ff1_numeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_numeric. In ff1_numeric, any formatting characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the formatting characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same output.
ff1_alphanumeric An alphanumeric string encrypted using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This format type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:
start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.
end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
is_allowed_input specifies if this type can be used as an input. is_allowed_output specifies if this type can be used as an output during translations. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_alphanumeric. In ff1_alphanumeric, any formatting characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the formatting characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same output.
ff1_printable_ascii ASCII printable characters from 33 to 126 (excluding any characters specified in the formatting_characters) are considered as part of the input data and are tangled or encrypted.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:
start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.
end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
is_allowed_input specifies if this type can be used as an input. is_allowed_output specifies if this type can be used as an output during translations. Note: The start and end attributes are applied after stripping the formatting characters.
ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak Similar to ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak. In ff1_printable_ascii, any formatting characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak, the formatting characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same output.

Allowed Translation Types

Allowed From Types Allowed To Types
clear, encrypted_keyword, tangled_keyword, ff1_numeric, ff1_numeric_no_tweak, ff1_alphanumeric, ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, ff1_printable_asciiff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak clear, encrypted_keyword, tangled_keyword, ff1_numeric, ff1_numeric_no_tweak, ff1_alphanumeric, ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, ff1_printable_ascii, ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak, masked

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. INVALID_TYPE indicates that you have specified an invalid type in one of the fields. UDT_SCHEMA_EXISTS indicates that the UDT definition already exists.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Returns the formats defined in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -H "x-tn-access-key: password" -d '{
    "valid_character_set": "numeric",
    "max_length": 12,
    "formatting_characters": "-",
    "formats": {
      "clear": {
        "type": "clear",
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe": {
        "type": "ff1_numeric",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 19,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe_printable_ascii":{
        "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 11,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe_printable_ascii_no_tweak":{
        "type": "ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak",
        "start": 0,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "partially_masked": {
        "type": "masked",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 7,
        "mask_character": "*",
        "is_allowed_input": false,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      }
    },
    "transformations": {
      "web_to_db": {
        "from": "clear",
        "to": "fpe"
      }
    }
  }' "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/4.0"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/4.0 HTTP/1.1

x-tn-access-key: password
