GET UDT Definition

Use this endpoint to retrieve an existing UDT definition.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: GET
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{definition_name}/{version}

Parameters

You must specify the UDT definition name and version as path parameters.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Returns the formats defined in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -H "x-tn-access-key: password" "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/11.0"

Modify UDT Definition

Use this endpoint to update an existing UDT definition. You can update the following fields in the UDT definition:

  • Add new formats
  • Add new transformations
  • Add or modify formatting_characters if existing formats do not have any ff1 type formats
  • Increase max_length if it is not empty
  • Decrease min_length if it is not empty

Invalid modification : modifying existing format, for example, modifying the type and is_allowed_input

from: "fpe": {
        "type": "ff1_numeric",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 19,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      
to: "fpe": {
        "type": "ff1_numeric",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 19,
        "is_allowed_input": false,	
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },

Valid modification: Adding a new transformation

"clear_to_partially_masked": {
        "from": "clear",
        "to": "partially_masked"
      }

Valid modification: Adding a new format

"ssn": {
        "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 19,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      }

Valid modification: Increase max_length

from: "max_length": 13
to: "max_length": 14

Valid modification: Decrease min_length

from: "min_length": 13
to: "min_length": 12

Parameters

You must specify the UDT definition name and version as path parameters.

You must also specify the UDT definition in the JSON format in the response body. The JSON format is defined in the POST {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version} endpoint.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: PUT
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{udt_name}/{version}

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. UDT_ELEMENT_VALUE_UPDATE_NOT_ALLOWED indicates that you have performed an invalid update operation.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Returns the formats defined in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -H "x-tn-access-key: password" -d '{
    "valid_character_set": "printable_ascii",
    "max_length": 12,
    "formatting_characters": "!@#$%^&*()))",
    "formats": {
      "clear": {
        "type": "clear",
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe": {
        "type": "ff1_numeric",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 19,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe_printable_ascii":{
        "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 11,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "fpe_printable_ascii_no_tweak":{
        "type": "ff1_printable_ascii_no_tweak",
        "start": 0,
        "is_allowed_input": true,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      },
      "partially_masked": {
        "type": "masked",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 7,
        "mask_character": "*",
        "is_allowed_input": false,
        "is_allowed_output": true
      }
    },
    "transformations": {
      "web_to_db": {
        "from": "clear",
        "to": "fpe"
      }
    }
  }' "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/8.0"

Delete UDT Definition

Use this endpoint to delete an existing UDT definition.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: DELETE
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/{definition_name}/{version}

Parameters

You must specify the UDT definition name and version as path parameters.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. SCHEMA_NOT_EXISTS indicates that the specified UDT definition does not exist.
  • message: Includes verbose information about the code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -H "x-tn-access-key: password" "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/4.0"
DELETE %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v1/udt/definition/us_ssn_kal/4.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
X-TN-Customer: customer
x-tn-access-key: password
  • Delete UDT Definition
  • Error: Delete UDT Definition
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositioninline;filename=f.txt
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 01 Feb 2023 12:29:41 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "Deleted successfully"
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Dispositioninline;filename=f.txt
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 01 Feb 2023 12:29:11 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SCHEMA_NOT_EXISTS",
    "message": "Schema [us_ssn] not exists"
}

Translate Data

Use this endpoint to translate data from one format to another.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{definition_name}/{version}/{from_type}/{to_type}

Parameters

You must specify the following PATH parameters:

PATH Parameter Description
{definition_name} Specifies the UDT definition name.
{version} Specifies the UDT definition version.
{from_type} Specifies the input format. Note: This format must be one of the formats defined in the UDT definition. Any format type with the property "is_allowed_input": true can be used.
{to_type} Specifies the output format. Specifies the input format. Note: This format must be one of the formats defined in the UDT definition. Any format type with the property "is_allowed_output": true can be used.

Allowed Translation Types

Allowed From Types Allowed To Types
clear, encrypted_keyword, tangled_keyword, ff1_numeric, ff1_numeric_no_tweak, ff1_alphanumeric, ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, ff1_printable_ascii clear, encrypted_keyword, tangled_keyword, ff1_numeric, ff1_numeric_no_tweak, ff1_alphanumeric, ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, ff1_printable_ascii, masked

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. INVALID_FORMAT indicates that you have specified an invalid format in the translation request.

  • message:Verbose information corresponding to code.

  • result : Returns the data in the specified output format.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -d '{"input": [
        "123-123-123",
        "-123-123-123",
        "-1-2-3-1-2-3-1-2-3"}' "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/us_ssn/1.0/clear/fpe_printable_ascii_no_tweak"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v1/udt/translate/us_ssn/1.0/clear/fpe_printable_ascii_no_tweak HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
X-TN-Customer: customer

{"input": [
        "123-123-123",
        "-123-123-123",
        "-1-2-3-1-2-3-1-2-3"}
  • CLEAR_TO_PARTIALLY_MASKED
  • CLEAR_TO_FPE_ASCII
  • Clear to FPE_PRINTABLE_NO_TWEAK
  • Error: Translate Data
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 02 Feb 2023 05:17:28 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        "***-***-123",
        "-***-***-123",
        "-*-*-*-*-2-3-1-2-3"
    ]
}

    "result": [
        "]z5-T?e-()[",

        "-!-E-9-z-@-%-1-2-3"
    ]

Translate Data using Pre-defined Transformations

Use this endpoint to translate from a format type to another using pre-defined transformations. The transformations are part of the UDT definition.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/{definition_name}/{version}/{transformation_name}

Parameters

You must specify the following PATH parameters:

PATH Parameter Description
{definition_name} Specifies the UDT definition name.
{version} Specifies the UDT definition version.
{transformation_name} Specifies the transformation name as defined in the UDT definition.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. INVALID_TRANSFORMATION indicates that you have specified an invalid transformation.
  • message: Verbose information corresponding to code.
  • result : Returns the data in the output format.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-TN-Customer: customer" -d '{"input":["AQAAAAEAAAGFyqfRfM/70H6iCbeQRxvNfpZCgj/1GqkF"]}' "{{pantherURL}}/v1/udt/translate/us_ssn/1.0/encrypted_to_masked"
POST %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v1/udt/translate/us_ssn/1.0/encrypted_to_masked HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
X-TN-Customer: customer

{"input":["AQAAAAEAAAGFyqfRfM/70H6iCbeQRxvNfpZCgj/1GqkF"]}
  • Transform Data
  • Error: Transform Data
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 02 Feb 2023 05:21:43 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        "867-79-3181"
    ]
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 02 Feb 2023 05:21:11 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "INVALID_TRANSFORMATION",
    "message": "invalid transformation: [encrypted_to_masked]"
}

Vault

Titaniam Encrypted Analytical Vault is a NoSQL datastore. Store your most valuable data and conduct full-featured search analytics while keeping the data encrypted at all times.

Vault Tokens

Vault lets you encrypt, store, decrypt, and search the following data types. Each Vault endpoint can support all or some of these data types. See the endpoint description for any limitations.

Data Type Tangled Types Supported Queries FIPS Compliant? Description
keyword tangled_keyword3_tangled Term, Prefix (maximum 21 characters), Suffix (maximum 21 characters) Yes A string with a maximum length of 708 characters. This data type supports term, prefix, and suffix searches.
tiny_keyword tangled_tiny_keyword_tangled Term, Prefix (maximum 21 characters), Suffix (maximum 21 characters), Wildcard (max 32 characters) No A string with a maximum length of 32 characters. This data type supports term, prefix, suffix, and wildcard searches.
keyword_compact encrypted_keyword_tangled Term Yes A string with a maximum length of 24543 characters. This data type supports term searches. When tangled, keyword_compact occupies less space compared to the keyword data type.
text tangled_tiny_text2_tangled, tangled_tiny_text2_suffix_tangled(for suffix search) Match, Match Phrase, Match Phrase Prefix Yes A large string
integer tangled_integer_tangled Term, Range No A signed 32-bit integer with a minimum value of -2^31 and a maximum value of (2^31)-1
ip tangled_ip_tangled Term, Term CIDR No IP address. Can be of the IPV4 or IPV6 format.
date_no_millis tangled_date_tangled Term, Range No Date in the following format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss. For example: 2021-03-14 23:45:12.
base64 File keyword No Search No A binary file such as a PDF or JPEG encoded in the base64 format.
base64 Text keyword No Search No Base64 encoded text.

Store Data

Use this endpoint to encrypt and store data in Vault. When you store data, the data is encrypted using the AES algorithm and stored in the Vault.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store Store data
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store/bulk Store bulk data in Elasticsearch. Note: The maximum number of records in a bulk request is 1000.

Body Parameters

Parameter Required Supported Values
data_type Optional keyword, integer, ip, text, date, base64. If data_type is not specified, it defaults to keyword.
value Mandatory Value of the data_type.
field_name Optional Any string. Specifies a field_name for the data_type.
include_protected_field Optional True or False (default); If True, the tangled form of the value is returned in the response. You can use this tangled value to implement search in your application. If False, the tangled response is not returned. This parameter is not supported for text and base64 data_types.
include_value Optional True or False. Default is True. If this field is set to False, the value field is ignored in the response.
passthrough Optional Any string. If passthrough is present in the request payload, this field in the response is the same value as in the request.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

  • guid: A guid (global unique ID) is generated in response that you can later use to retrieve the data.
  • protected_field: If you have specified a include_protected_field parameter as true, this API returns a tangled form of the data that you can use to implement search in your application.
  • es: Time (in millisecond) taken for ingest data in Elasticsearch. A PTOS in the value indicates zero.
  • db: Time (in millisecond) taken for ingest data in MySQL. A PTOS in the value indicates zero.

When the sdss.store.elapsed.millis property is set during the Titaniam Server deployment, the response will include the following headers:

  • X-tn-es-lookup-millis: Time in milliseconds to look up if the index exists in the Elasticsearch index.
  • X-tn-es-millis: Time in milliseconds taken for ingest data in Elasticsearch. A PTOS in the value indicates zero.
  • X-tn-db-millis: Time in milliseconds taken for ingest data in datastore. A PTOS in the value indicates zero.
  • X-tn-total-time-millis:: Total time taken to execute the bulk query.

Keyword Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type":"keyword",
    "field_name":"title",
    "value":"abcd",
    "include_protected_field":"true"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/store HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type":"keyword",
    "field_name":"title",
    "value":"abcd",
    "include_protected_field":"true"
}
  • Keyword Write_protected_field
  • Keyword Write_no_protected_field

Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 20 May 2021 09:55:46 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "guid": "tn:658f8186-6181-4613-a232-b5acc7967500",
        "protected_field": "03%X#06JpWOya06Be^!l706(d4&j}",
        "es": "PT0S",
        "db": "PT0S"
    }
}

    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "guid": "tn:658f8186-6181-4613-a232-b5acc7967500",
        "es": "PT0S",
        "db": "PT0S"
    }
}

Text: Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type":"text",
    "value":"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.",
    "field_name":"paragraph"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/store HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type":"text",
    "value":"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.",
    "field_name":"paragraph"
}

Integer: Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "integer",
    "field_name": "transaction_date",
    "value": "12345",
    "include_protected_field":true
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/store HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type": "integer",
    "field_name": "transaction_date",
    "value": "12345",
    "include_protected_field":true
}

IP: Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "ip",
    "field_name": "source ip",
    "value": "123.234.123.12",
    "include_protected_field":true
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store"

DateTime: Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP

    "data_type": "date_no_millis",
    "field_name": "event_date",
    "value": "2021-03-11 23:45:12",
    "include_protected_field":true
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store"

Bulk Write

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '[
    {
        "field_name": "age_test",
        "value": "123456",
        "include_protected_field":false
    },
    {
        "data_type": "integer",
        "field_name": "age",
        "value": "20",
        "include_protected_field":false
    },
    {
        "data_type": "keyword",
        "field_name": "title",
        "value": "abcd",
        "include_protected_field":true
    },
    {
        "data_type": "ip",
        "field_name": "source ip",
        "value": "123.234.123.12"
    },
    {
        "data_type": "date",
        "field_name": "transaction_date",
        "value": "2021-03-10"
    }
]' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/store/bulk"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/store/bulk HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

[
    {
        "field_name": "age_test",
        "value": "123456",
        "include_protected_field":false

            "value": "123.234.123.12"
        }
    },
    {
        "index": 4,
        "code": "SUCCESS",
        "message": "success",
        "result": {
            "guid": "tn:b19ee69d-f3ef-45e5-9fcc-9ca3d54bd254",
            "value": "2021-03-10"
        }
    }
]

Retrieve Data

Use this endpoint to retrieve data from Vault. You can retrieve data using a guid.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve Fetch data
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve/bulk Fetch bulk data from Elasticsearch index

Body Parameters

If you are retrieving data using guid, specify the following parameters.

Parameters Required Description
guid Mandatory Token generated by Vault when securing and storing data.
view Optional Determines how the data is displayed in the response. Supported values are: clear, masked, tangled. If view is not specified, it defaults to masked.
When view is masked, you can set the following additional attributes: view_specification that allows you to specify what parts of the output are masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to show in clear text in the output. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will not mask ‘-’ in the output. “-/” will not mask “-” “/” characters in the output. If you do not specify this field, all characters in the output field are masked. start: This field specifies the start index field. The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the value field has an index 0. The start attribute defaults to 0. If you specify this start field, you can also specify the index end field. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked.

If you are retrieving data using value, use the following parameters:

Parameters Required Description
data_type Mandatory Specify the data_type that you are fetching. The text and base64 data_types are not supported.
value Mandatory Specify the tangled value of the data that you are fetching. Spectra generates this tangled value when you stored the data.
view Optional Determines how the data is displayed in the response. Supported values are: clear, masked, tangled. If view is not specified, it defaults to masked.
field_name Mandatory Specify the field_name that you used to store the data.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • data: Data is returned in the format specified by the view parameter.
  • guid: Token used to retrieve the data.
  • created_date : Date when the data was encrypted and stored.
  • created_by : User who encrypted and stored data.
  • hash : Hash of the stored data.
  • field_name : field_name specified when the data was encrypted and stored. If field_name was not specified, null is returned.

Error Handling

  • When you specify a non-existent guid, the endpoint still displays a success response. However, the result is empty.
  • Unrecognized Character escape errors might occur when retrieving data using value. This error occurs when an API client such as Postman converts write responses to Pretty format. In such cases, sequences such as \u4xxx are converted to the actual unicode characters in the Pretty mode. To prevent these errors, ensure that you use the raw format.
  • API clients such as postman use a backslash to escape characters. If the tangled value in your write response includes a sequence: \\, Postman escapes the backslash. This design invalidates the tangled value. Ensure that when using clients such as Postman, you use the raw mode to copy the tangled values.

Keyword: Fetch by guid

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "guid": "tn:562522dd-6e92-41b0-a4df-65085cab8f3a",
    "view":"tangled"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/retrieve HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "guid": "tn:562522dd-6e92-41b0-a4df-65085cab8f3a",
    "view":"tangled"
}

Keyword: Fetch by guid: Masked

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "guid": "tn:8839f9b6-7f34-4fc3-afb7-ac74e321e7dd",
    "view":"masked",
    "view_specification": {
        "start": 0,
        "end": 4,
        "formatting_characters": "!@#"
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"

Content-Type: application/json

    "guid": "tn:8839f9b6-7f34-4fc3-afb7-ac74e321e7dd",
    "view":"masked",
    "view_specification": {
        "start": 0,
        "end": 4,
        "formatting_characters": "!@#"
    }
}

Integer: Fetch by guid

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "guid":"tn:2ce02190-dbd2-43fb-b1f8-441171645411",
    "view":"clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/retrieve HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "guid":"tn:2ce02190-dbd2-43fb-b1f8-441171645411",
    "view":"clear"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 08 Apr 2021 03:51:33 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "secure_integer": "12345",
            "guid": "tn:2ce02190-dbd2-43fb-b1f8-441171645411",
            "created_date": "2021-04-08T03:42:10Z",
            "created_by": "system",
            "hash": "2qxmIsQZ3PjkDVK0r8FA3ovY7GvEx1rV7DhVaiN73LE=",
            "field_name": "transaction_date"
        }
    ]
}

Integer: Fetch by value

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "integer",
    "value": "324778708937",
    "view": "clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/retrieve HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type": "integer",
    "value": "324778708937",
    "view": "clear"
}

Status0

    "view":"clear"

  • Curl
  • HTTP

    "view": "clear",
    "field_name": "source ip"
}' "{{SpectraURL}}/secure/retrieve/v2"

}

  • HTTP

     "guid":"tn:afbb1cab-056e-4676-bc33-57063192979e",
    "view":"clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"

     "guid":"tn:afbb1cab-056e-4676-bc33-57063192979e",
    "view":"clear"
}

{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "guid": "tn:afbb1cab-056e-4676-bc33-57063192979e",

            "created_by": "system",

    ]
}

DateTime: Fetch by value

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "date_no_millis",
    "value": 969844022075487339,
    "view": "clear",
    "field_name": "event_date"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/retrieve HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type": "date_no_millis",
    "value": 969844022075487339,
    "view": "clear",
    "field_name": "event_date"
}
  • Response
Status0 
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "guid": "tn:afbb1cab-056e-4676-bc33-57063192979e",
            "created_date": "2021-04-09T01:37:26Z",
            "created_by": "system",
            "secure_date_no_millis": "2021-03-11 23:45:12",
            "hash": "g399iOkuxAbDv/T5LBqRaNVPf1BWPobvLwBBHq8w+7Y=",
            "field_name": "event_date"
        }
    ]
}

Bulk Fetch

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '[
    {
        "guid": "tn:dee5ceb0-74db-4cbf-b96f-9b8ebf4415c2",
        "view": "tangled"
    },
    {
        "guid": "tn:c721edc7-57b3-4506-9aec-b304a04993e7",
        "view": "clear"
    },
    {
        "guid": "tn:5fa61e46-ffc7-499b-8431-1255dfbdc1b8",
        "view": "masked"
    }
]' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/retrieve/bulk"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/retrieve/bulk HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

[
    {
        "guid": "tn:dee5ceb0-74db-4cbf-b96f-9b8ebf4415c2",
        "view": "tangled"
    },
    {
        "guid": "tn:c721edc7-57b3-4506-9aec-b304a04993e7",
        "view": "clear"
    },
    {
        "guid": "tn:5fa61e46-ffc7-499b-8431-1255dfbdc1b8",
        "view": "masked"
    }

                "field_name": "age"

        "code": "SUCCESS",
        "message": "success",
        "result": [
            {
                "secure_integer": "xxxxxxxx",
                "guid": "tn:5fa61e46-ffc7-499b-8431-1255dfbdc1b8",
                "created_date": "2021-04-07T11:29:56Z",
                "created_by": "system",
                "hash": "rbWeoTpL2mRq4KYZb9Tno1Y2LojKp4nC+6fYmx7ffhU=",
                "field_name": "age"
            }
        ]
    }
]

Search Data

Use this endpoint to search for data. The data_type determines the type of searches you can perform on the data. You can also specify how the data is returned in the response.

Data Type and Search Type Mapping

  • keyword: term, prefix, suffix
  • integer: term, range
  • ip: term, CIDR
  • text: match_phrase, match_phrase_prefix, match_phrase_suffix
  • base64: Search is not supported

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search

Parameters

Parameters Required Values Description
data_type Optional keyword, integer, ip, text, date Note: base64 data type is not supported. If data_type is not specified, it defaults to keyword.
value Mandatory Depends on the data_type Search input.
search_type Mandatory term, prefix, suffix, wildcard, match_phrase, match_phrase_prefix, match_phrase_suffix, range The search_type depends on the data_type.
view Optional clear, masked, tangled Determines how the data is displayed in the response. Supported values are: clear, masked, tangled. If view is not specified, it defaults to masked.
When view is masked, you can set the following additional attributes: view_specification that allows you to specify what parts of the output are masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to show in clear text in the output. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will not mask ‘-’ in the output. “-/” will not mask “-” “/” characters in the output. If you do not specify this field, all characters in the output field are masked. start: This field specifies the start index field. The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the value field has an index 0. The start attribute default to 0. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked.
gt, gte, lt, lte Optional when search_type is range integer or date (Greater than), (Greater than or equal to), (Less than), or (Lesser than or equal to) . At least one of gt, gte, lt, or lte must be mentioned when the search_type is range.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • data: Data is returned in the format specified by the view parameter.
  • guid: Token used to retrieve the data.
  • created_date : Date when the data was encrypted and stored.
  • created_by : User who encrypted and stored data.
  • hash : Hash of the stored data.
  • field_name : field_name specified when the data was encrypted and stored. If field_name was not specified, null is returned.

Keyword: Term Search

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "keyword",
    "search_type": "term",
    "value": "123-23-1234",
    "view": "clear",
    "field_name": "tax_id_number"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/search HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type": "keyword",
    "search_type": "term",
    "value": "123-23-1234",
    "view": "clear",
    "field_name": "tax_id_number"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateFri, 06 Jan 2023 04:26:58 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "metadata": {
        "took": 2,
        "total": 1,
        "from": 0,
        "size": 10
    },
    "result": [
        {
            "secure_keyword": "123-23-1234",
            "guid": "tn:8839f9b6-7f34-4fc3-afb7-ac74e321e7dd",
            "created_date": "2022-02-22T05:39:12Z",
            "created_by": "system",
            "field_name": "tax_id_number"
        }
    ]
}

Keyword: Term Search: Masked

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type": "keyword",
    "search_type": "term",
    "value": "123-23-1234",
    "view": "masked",
    "field_name": "tax_id_number",
    "view_specification": {
        "start": 0,
        "end": 4,
        "formatting_characters": "!@#"
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/search HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type": "keyword",
    "search_type": "term",
    "value": "123-23-1234",
    "view": "masked",
    "field_name": "tax_id_number",
    "view_specification": {
        "start": 0,
        "end": 4,
        "formatting_characters": "!@#"
    }
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateFri, 06 Jan 2023 04:21:49 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "metadata": {
        "took": 12,
        "total": 1,
        "from": 0,
        "size": 10
    },
    "result": [
        {
            "secure_keyword": "xxxxx3-1234",
            "guid": "tn:8839f9b6-7f34-4fc3-afb7-ac74e321e7dd",
            "created_date": "2022-02-22T05:39:12Z",
            "created_by": "system",
            "field_name": "tax_id_number"
        }
    ]
}

  • Curl
  • HTTP

    "data_type":"text",
    "search_type":"match_phrase_prefix",
    "value":"adipis",
    "view":"clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search"

    "value":"adipis",
    "view":"clear"

Scelerisque varius morbi enim nunc faucibus a. Dignissim convallis aenean et tortor at risus viverra adipiscing at. Imperdiet nulla malesuada pellentesque elit eget gravida. Donec adipiscing tristique risus nec feugiat in fermentum. Elementum sagittis vitae et leo. Volutpat diam ut venenatis tellus in metus vulputate eu. Accumsan in nisl nisi scelerisque eu. Faucibus nisl tincidunt eget nullam non nisi est sit amet. In hac habitasse platea dictumst vestibulum rhoncus. Ipsum consequat nisl vel pretium lectus quam.\n\nFeugiat in ante metus dictum at tempor commodo ullamcorper. Tempor id eu nisl nunc mi ipsum faucibus. Sit amet risus nullam eget felis eget nunc. At consectetur lorem donec massa sapien faucibus et molestie ac. Euismod elementum nisi quis eleifend quam adipiscing vitae. Tristique sollicitudin nibh sit amet commodo. Ac tincidunt vitae semper quis lectus nulla. Netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas sed tempus urna. Vitae nunc sed velit dignissim sodales ut. Habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus.\n\nNeque volutpat ac tincidunt vitae semper quis. Egestas congue quisque egestas diam in arcu cursus. Non quam lacus suspendisse faucibus interdum posuere lorem. Nullam ac tortor vitae purus. Pellentesque diam volutpat commodo sed egestas. Blandit massa enim nec dui nunc mattis. Pretium vulputate sapien nec sagittis. Nec sagittis aliquam malesuada bibendum arcu. Diam in arcu cursus euismod quis viverra nibh cras pulvinar. Dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit pellentesque habitant. Faucibus in ornare quam viverra orci. Nullam vehicula ipsum a arcu cursus vitae congue. Tellus elementum sagittis vitae et leo duis ut. Faucibus interdum posuere lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing. Fringilla phasellus faucibus scelerisque eleifend donec pretium. Tristique sollicitudin nibh sit amet commodo nulla. Elementum curabitur vitae nunc sed.",
            "guid": "tn:0e500af7-e66e-4c77-aff7-537f506a93d5",
            "created_date": "2021-03-19T07:13:22Z",
            "created_by": "system",
            "hash": "5h+wYVONOLCtPtPmlwhHwsy62kE2zSK05OwVKHvkCDg=",
            "field_name": "body"
        }
    ]
}

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type":"text",
    "search_type":"match_phrase_suffix",
    "value":"lor",
    "view":"clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search"

    "search_type":"match_phrase_suffix",
    "value":"lor",
    "view":"clear"

Delete Data

Use this endpoint to delete data using guid. You can choose to specify one more guids with this endpoint.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: DELETE
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/delete

Parameters

Parameter Required Values Description
guids At least one guid is mandatory A list of valid guids The data associated with the specified guids is deleted.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the deletion was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the deletion for the particular guid was successful. NOT_FOUND indicates that the specified guid does not exist in the data store.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Deleted successfully
    • NOT_FOUND: {guid} does not exist in the data store
  • input : Specifies the list of guids.

Delete Data

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
   "guids":["tn:b111ae47-981c-4974-913e-5e2dbc3a5967", "test"]
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/delete"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/delete HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "guids":["tn:b111ae47-981c-4974-913e-5e2dbc3a5967", "test"]
}
  • Delete Data
  • Invalid guid
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 08 Apr 2021 08:40:26 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
[
    {
        "code": "SUCCESS",
        "message": "Deleted successfully",
        "input": {
            "guid": "tn:b111ae47-981c-4974-913e-5e2dbc3a5967"
        }
    }
]
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 08 Apr 2021 10:42:33 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
[
    {
        "code": "SUCCESS",
        "message": "Deleted successfully",
        "input": {
            "guid": "tn:b111ae47-981c-4974-913e-5e2dbc3a5967"
        }
    },
    {
        "code": "NOT_FOUND",
        "message": "test not exists in DB",
        "input": {
            "guid": "test"
        }
    }
]

Search Terms

Use this endpoint to retrieve search terms for your data. Search terms are the tangled values of the data_type stored in Vault. Vault returns all the tangled values available for this data. You can further use these tangled values to run search queries in your application. This endpoint is useful in cases where the data has been ingested into Vault using different keys and you want to search the data in your application using the tangled values.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search_terms

Description

The data_type determines the type of searches you can perform on the data. You can also specify how the data is returned in the response.

Parameters

Parameters Required Values Description
data_type Optional keyword, integer, ip, date Note: base64 and text data types are not supported. If data_type is not specified, it defaults to keyword.
value Mandatory Depends on the data_type. value is the untangled clear text.

Headers

In a multi-tenancy setup, you can include the following headers in the request.

Headers Required Values Description
X-tn-customer Optional; Use this header only if you are using the bring your own key (BYOK) mode Customer ID Use this header if you are using the Vault with a BYOK mode. When you use this header, the search terms in the response are specific to the tenant (customer ID).

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. NOT_FOUND indicates that the search terms do not exist in the data store.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
    • NOT_FOUND: {guid} does not exist in the data store
  • result : Lists the search terms found in the data store for the corresponding input. If more than one search term exists, all the terms are returned in an array.
  • data_type: Specifies the data_type of the returned search terms.

Keyword: Retrieve Search Terms

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type":"keyword",
    "value":"abcd"    
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search_terms"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/search_terms HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type":"keyword",
    "value":"abcd"    
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 20 May 2021 13:15:07 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "search_terms": [
            "03%X#06JpWOya06Be^!l706(d4&j}",
            "03E!`068v=8Aa06x7y{@T06>MwXU-"
        ],
        "data_type": "keyword"
    }
}

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "data_type":"integer",
    "value":"12345"    
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/search_terms"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/search_terms HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "data_type":"integer",
    "value":"12345"    
}

                "lower": 7411353992901,

                "upper": 969744137037814467
            }
        ],
        "data_type": "date_no_millis"
    }
}

Key Rotation Endpoints

Titaniam Vault uses the Key Registry Service (KRS) for key rotation. KRS is a centralized system for managing the metadata for your encryption keys. It is designed to provide a secure and efficient way to manage the use of encryption keys in your organization.

KRS includes the following features to help you manage and use your encryption keys effectively.

  • Provides an abstraction layer to your key stores
  • Ability to register key metadata from various key services such as AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault, and Hashicorp Vault
  • Ability to store multi-tenant key metadata

The following set of endpoints let you rotate keys using KRS.

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/tenant Create default tenant
POST {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation Schedule key rotation
PUT {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest Swap index aliases
PUT {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key-rotation/latest Rerun failed tasks
GET {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key-rotation/latest/status Verify key rotation status
GET {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation Get key rotation list

Migrate Existing Key Metadata to Default Tenant

Use this endpoint to migrate you existing key metadata to a default tenant in Titaniam Vault. You must use this endpoint when upgrading Titaniam Vault to use KRS.

Note: You must use this endpoint only when you are migrating for the first time to KRS. After the migration, you need not use this endpoint again.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/tenant

Parameters

You must specify the following parameters in the JSON body of the request.

Parameter Mandatory Description
create_default Yes Specifies if the tenant is the default tenant or not. If set to true, the tenant is the default tenant.
tenant_name Yes Specifies the tenant name. This name must match the ACTIVE_KEY_NAME in the AWS Secrets Manager. The secret name in AWS is of the format: titaniam_key_ring/DEPARTMENT_NAME/ACTIVE_KEY_NAME
description Yes Description for the tenant_name you are using. Give as much information as possible so that users can distinguish between keys.
key_metadata Yes This field indicates the start of the key metadata.
key_name Yes Specifies the name of the key.
description Yes Description of the key.
store_type Yes Specifies where the keys are stored. The store_type determines the fields you need to mention in the location field. Currently, specify aws-secretsmanager to specify that the keys are stored in the AWS Secrets Manager.
location Yes Includes the fields in the following table rows.
secretName Yes Specifies the secret that includes the key you intend to use. Secret name is of the format: titaniam_key_ring/DEPARTMENT_NAME/ACTIVE_KEY_NAME
secretKeyEncrypted Yes Secret key required to access the AWS Secrets Manager. You must encrypt this secret key using the Titaniam Zero-day encryption service.
region Yes Specifies the location of the AWS Secrets Manager.
accessKeyEncrypted Yes Specifies the access key required to access AWS Secrets Manager. You must encrypt this access key using the Titaniam Zero-day encryption service.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. ERROR indicates that the Titaniam Server is not configured in KRS mode.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the following fields: guid specifies the key rotation id. status indicates if the key rotation has started. type is set to key-rotation, schema_name is the tenant_name. created_by indicates who has triggered the key-rotation. This is set to system.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "create_default": true,
    "tenant_name": "",
    "description": "default tenant",
    "key_metadata": {
        "key_name": "default-key1",
        "description": "key_description",
        "store_type": "aws-secretsmanager",
        "location": {
            "secretName": "titaniam_key_ring/DEPARTMENT_NAME/ACTIVE_KEY_NAME",
            "secretKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYTPED_AWS_SECRET_ID",
            "region": "REGION",
            "accessKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYPTED_AWS_ACCESS_ID"
        }
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/tenant"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/tenant HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "tenant_name": "",
    "description": "default tenant",
    "key_metadata": {
        "key_name": "default-key1",
        "description": "key_description",
        "store_type": "aws-secretsmanager",
        "location": {
            "secretName": "titaniam_key_ring/DEPARTMENT_NAME/ACTIVE_KEY_NAME",
            "secretKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYTPED_AWS_SECRET_ID",
            "region": "REGION",
            "accessKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYPTED_AWS_ACCESS_ID"
        }
    }
}
  • Migrating Key Metadata to Default Tenant
  • Error: Migrating Key Metadata to Default Tenant
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateFri, 20 Jan 2023 12:27:12 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": "Data migrated to default tenant {tenantName} successfully."
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateFri, 20 Jan 2023 12:27:12 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "TENANT_NAME_NOT_SAME_AS_DEFAULT",
    "message": "Tenant name must to be same as default tenant name specified in configuration"
}

Schedule Key Rotation

Use this endpoint to schedule a key rotation in KRS. Use this endpoint after you have decided on the encryption key and added the new key to the AWS Secrets Manager.

Use this endpoint in the following scenarios:

  • This must be the first endpoint to use when you want to rotate keys in the KRS mode.
  • When a scheduled key rotation is ABANDONED. ABANDONED is a state when a scheduled key rotation fails and you have rerun the alias swapping.

Note: When scheduling a key rotation, you must always use a new key. Even if you are executing this endpoint after a failed key rotation.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

You must specify the following parameters in the JSON body of the request.

Parameter Mandatory Description
type Yes Specifies the Titaniam Server module (Vault tokens) for which you want to rotate keys. Supported value is vault_token.
number_of_shards Optional Defines the number of primary shards an Elasticsearch destination index must have. This setting defaults to 1. The number of shards must be greater than or equal to 1. Based on this setting, Titaniam Vault creates the Elasticsearch index.
number_of_replicas Optional Defines the number of replicas an Elasticsearch destination index must have. Defaults to1. The number of replicase must be greater than or equal to 0
reindex_slices Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Set to a number or auto. When set to auto, Elasticsearch creates slices equal to the number of primary shards in the source index. If you are explicitly specifying a number, the best practice is to set it equal to the number of shards in the source index. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.slices set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch does not create any slices in the reindex task.
reindex_batch_size Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the number of documents to reindex per batch in Elasticsearch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 10000}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.batch_size set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 1000.
reindex_scroll_timeout_mins Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the scroll timeout in minutes. That is, the time required to complete reindexing of the batch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 1440}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.scroll_timeout_mins set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 5 minutes.
key_name Yes Specifies the name of the key.
description Yes Description of the key.
store_type Yes Specifies where the keys are stored. The store_type determines the fields you need to mention in the location field. aws-secretsmanagerspecifies that the keys are stored in the AWS Secrets Manager.
location Yes Includes details about the seed store.
secretName Yes Specifies the secret that includes the key you intend to use.
secretKeyEncrypted Yes Secret key required to access the AWS Secrets Manager. You must encrypt this secret key using the Titaniam Zero-day encryption service.
region Yes Specifies the location of the AWS Secrets Manager.
accessKeyEncrypted Yes Specifies the access key required to access AWS Secrets Manager. You must encrypt this access key using the Titaniam Zero-day encryption service.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. ERROR indicates that the Titaniam Server is not configured in KRS mode.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the following fields: guid specifies the key rotation id. status indicates if the key rotation is STARTED. type is set to key-rotation, schema_name is the tenant_name. created_by indicates who has triggered the key-rotation. This is set to system.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "auto",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10,
    "key_metadata": {
        "key_name": "sdss-store-key4",
        "description": "key4 for key rotation",
        "store_type": "aws-secretsmanager",
        "location": {
            "secretName": "titaniam_key_ring/reindex-test/key4",
            "secretKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYTPED_AWS_SECRET_ID",
            "region": "ap-south-1",
            "accessKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYPTED_AWS_ACCESS_ID"
        }
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "auto",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10,
    "key_metadata": {
        "key_name": "sdss-store-key4",
        "description": "key4 for key rotation",
        "store_type": "aws-secretsmanager",
        "location": {
            "secretName": "titaniam_key_ring/reindex-test/key4",
            "secretKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYTPED_AWS_SECRET_ID",
            "region": "ap-south-1",
            "accessKeyEncrypted": "ENCRYPTED_AWS_ACCESS_ID"
        }
    }
}
  • Schedule Key Rotation
  • Error: Schedule Key Rotation
  • Error: Schedule Key Rotation
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateMon, 16 Jan 2023 08:40:18 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "guid": "kr:d0c5fd14-8ff6-42bc-ac8e-52413eeb26c5",
        "status": "STARTED",
        "type": "KEY_ROTATION",
        "schema_name": "example_schema",
        "created_by": "system"
    }
}
Status500 Internal Server Error

}

Verify Key Rotation Status

Use this endpoint to verify the status of the latest schedule key rotation operation (such as scheduling key rotation, index alias swapping, and rerun key rotation). Use this endpoint only when you are using Titaniam Vault in KRS mode.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest/status

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

  • type: Set this to vault_token

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the parent request (such as scheduling key rotation, index alias swapping, and rerun key rotation) was successful or not. COMPLETED indicates that the alias swapping is successful. FAILED indicates that the alias swapping has failed. ABANDONED indicates that the rerun operation has failed.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful.
  • result : Lists the status the latest key rotation operation. The guid identifies the key rotation operation.

  • Elastic status: codeSpecifies if the operation was successful or not.

    • messageVerbose description related to code.
    • resultIncludes further fields about datastore records.
    • guid: guid of the key rotation activation operation in the datastore.
    • description Description of the reindexing operation.
    • elastic_task_idTask ID in Elasticsearch.
    • statusStatus of the key activation operation.
    • records_per_secSpecifies the number of records that are processed per second.
    • elapsed_time_secsSpecifies in seconds since the master task (such as scheduling key rotation, or swapping of aliases ) was initiated.
    • processedStatus of the key activation operation.
    • noteSpecifies the reason the total or completed fields read 0.
    • completedName of the Elasticsearch source document.
    • parent_guid: guid of the scheduled key rotation.

  • db_status includes information about the key rotation operation in the datastore.

Field Description
code Specifies if the operation was successful or not.
message Verbose description related to code.
result Includes further fields about datastore records
guid guid of the key rotation activation operation in the datastore.
type Type of records: binaries or tokens
total Number of records involved in indexing.
processed Number of records that are processed.
success Number of records that have been successfully reindexed.
failure Number of records that failed during reindexing.
status Status of the reindexing operation.
parent_guid guid of the scheduled key rotation.
retry_count Number of times the key rotation activation has been retried on the datastore.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d'{
   "type": "vault_token"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest/status"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest/status HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
{
   "type": "vault_token"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length114
DateMon, 16 Jan 2023 08:35:38 GMT
Connectionclose
{

    "message": "in-progress. please check after sometime",

        "parent_guid": "kr:ca228d41-91fc-4c40-ae1e-aafef58d9674"
    },
    "result": {
        "elasticsearch": {
            "in_progress": [
                {
                    "code": "IN_PROGRESS",
                    "message": "in-progress. please check after sometime",

                        "processed": 153000,
                        "failures": 0,
                        "created_at": "2023-03-15T06:33:57.434+00:00",

                        "records_per_sec": 6375,
                        "retry_count": 0
                    }
                }
            ],
            "completed": [
                {
                    "code": "SUCCESS",
                    "message": "success",
                    "result": {
                        "guid": "dkr:0a300b4b-6ac4-4a24-bf52-01aebf5c8711",
                        "type": "BINARIES",
                        "total": 4,
                        "processed": 4,
                        "failures": 0,
                        "created_at": "2023-03-15T06:33:57.429+00:00",
                        "retry_count": 0
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

Swap Aliases

Use this endpoint to swap aliases of indexes in a key in KRS. You must use this endpoint in the following sequence:

  1. Scheduled a key rotation
  2. Verify the status of the key rotation operation.
  3. Swap aliases in KRS.

Swapping aliases ensures that the existing documents in Elasticsearch are reindexed using the new key. Any new documents that are ingested to Elasticsearch use the new key. Similarly, the data in the datastore is also rotated with the new key.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

  • type: Set this to vault_token
  • action: Set this to swap_aliases

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. ERROR indicates that the Titaniam Server is not configured in KRS mode. REINDEX_FAILED when reindexing fails in Elasticsearch. DB_KEY_ROTATION_FAILED when key rotation fails in the data store. ABANDONED indicates that key rotation is abandoned after a rerun tries.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the following fields: guid specifies the latest scheduled key rotation id.
  • Field Description codeSpecifies if the operation was successful or not.messageVerbose description related to code.resultIncludes further fields about datastore records. guid: guid of the key rotation activation operation in the datastore.description Description of the reindexing operation. elastic_task_id Task ID in Elasticsearch.statusStatus of the key activation operation. source_index_nameName of the Elasticsearch source document. dest_index_nameName of the Elasticsearch destination document that uses the new key. parent_guid guid of the scheduled key rotation. created_by system indicates that the action was triggered by the system. created_atTimestamp when the task is created in Elasticsearch. updated_atTimestamp when the status message for the task was recorded in Elasticsearch. retry_countNumber of times the key rotation activation has been retried in Elasticsearch.
  • db_response includes information about the key rotation operation in the datastore.
Field Description
code Specifies if the operation was successful or not.
message Verbose description related to code.
result Includes further fields about datastore records
guid guid of the key rotation activation operation in the datastore.
type Type of records: binaries or tokens
total Number of records involved in indexing.
processed Number of records that are processed.
success Number of records that have been successfully reindexed.
failure Number of records that failed during reindexing.
status Status of the reindexing operation.
parent_guid guid of the scheduled key rotation.
retry_count Number of times the key rotation activation has been retried on the datastore.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
   "type": "vault_token",
   "action": "swap_aliases"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "type": "vault_token",
   "action": "swap_aliases"
}
  • Response

                        "retry_count": 0
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

Rerun Failed Tasks

Use this endpoint to rerun the failed tasks. If the alias swapping has failed (status for PUT {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest is set to FAILED), you must fix the errors and then run this endpoint. This endpoint must be used only in the KRS mode. You can use this endpoint only once after a failed alias swapping.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: PUT
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

Parameter Description
type Mandatory Set this to vault_token
action Mandatory Set this to rerun
number_of_shards Optional Defines the number of primary shards an Elasticsearch destination index must have. This setting defaults to 1. The number of shards must be greater than or equal to 1. Based on this setting, Titaniam Vault creates the Elasticsearch index.
number_of_replicas Optional Defines the number of replicas an Elasticsearch destination index must have. Defaults to1. The number of replicase must be greater than or equal to 0
reindex_slices Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Set to a number or auto. When set to auto, Elasticsearch creates slices equal to the number of primary shards in the source index. If you are explicitly specifying a number, the best practice is to set it equal to the number of shards in the source index. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.slices set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch does not create any slices in the reindex task.
reindex_batch_size Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the number of documents to reindex per batch in Elasticsearch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 10000}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.batch_size set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 1000.
reindex_scroll_timeout_mins Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the scroll timeout in minutes. That is, the time required to complete reindexing of the batch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 1440}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.scroll_timeout_mins set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 5 minutes.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Includes the following nested fields:
Field Description
guid Specifies the guid of the rerun operation.
status Specifies the status of the operation. RERUN_STARTED indicates the operation is has started.
type Indicates that this operation is key rotation operation.
schema_name Must match the tenant name that you used when scheduling key rotation.
created_by Indicates that the system has triggered the operation.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "action": "rerun",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "2",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "action": "rerun",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "2",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateMon, 16 Jan 2023 08:39:46 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "guid": "kr:83813c7e-7b37-42ba-9b32-f6d6c85f0795",
        "status": "IN_PROGRESS",
        "type": "KEY_ROTATION",
        "schema_name": "example_schema",
        "created_by": "system"
    }
}

Continue Database Tasks

Use this endpoint to rerun the database tasks during a key rotation. If the database key rotation is stuck (status for PUT {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest is set to IN PROGRESS), and there is no change in status for prolonged period of time (for example, 5 minutes). A good indication that the database tasks are stuck is that the number of records in the Status response do not change. For example, the database tasks might be stuck if the database service is down or the Titaniam Vault server is restarted during a key rotation operation. This endpoint must be used only in the KRS mode.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: PUT
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

  • type: Set this to vault_token
  • action: Set this to continue_db

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the database operations in the key rotation was resumed.
  • message: Specifies elaborate message related to code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
   "type": "vault_token",
   "action": "continue_db"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "type": "vault_token",
   "action": "continue_db"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateMon, 28 Feb 2023 08:39:46 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "DB key rotation resumed successfully"
}

Continue Elasticsearch Tasks

Use this endpoint to rerun the failed Elasticsearch tasks during a key rotation. If status of the key rotation operation is NOT set to COMPLETED, and there are errors in the Elasticsearch operations. This endpoint must be used only in the KRS mode.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: PUT
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest

Header

This endpoint requires you to mention the tenant name in the header if you have not set a default tenant in the KRS application through the property file.

X-tn-tenant={TENANT_NAME}

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

Parameter Description
type Mandatory Set this to vault_token
action Mandatory Set this to continue_elastic
number_of_shards Optional Defines the number of primary shards an Elasticsearch destination index must have. This setting defaults to 1. The number of shards must be greater than or equal to 1. Based on this setting, Titaniam Vault creates the Elasticsearch index.
number_of_replicas Optional Defines the number of replicas an Elasticsearch destination index must have. Defaults to1. The number of replicase must be greater than or equal to 0
reindex_slices Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Set to a number or auto. When set to auto, Elasticsearch creates slices equal to the number of primary shards in the source index. If you are explicitly specifying a number, the best practice is to set it equal to the number of shards in the source index. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.slices set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch does not create any slices in the reindex task.
reindex_batch_size Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the number of documents to reindex per batch in Elasticsearch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 10000}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.batch_size set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 1000.
reindex_scroll_timeout_mins Optional This parameter is used during a reindex process. Specifies the scroll timeout in minutes. That is, the time required to complete reindexing of the batch. You can set any value in the range {1 - 1440}. If you set this parameter, it overrides the sdss.es.reindex.scroll_timeout_mins set during deployment. If this parameter or the Titaniam property is not set, Elasticsearch sets the default value to 5 minutes.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the Elasticsearch operations in the key rotation was resumed.
  • message: Specifies elaborate message related to code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "action": "continue_elastic",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "2",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation/latest HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "type": "vault_token",
    "action": "continue_elastic",
    "number_of_shards": 3,
    "number_of_replicas": 2,
    "reindex_slices": "2",
    "reindex_batch_size": 500,
    "reindex_scroll_timeout_mins": 10
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateMon, 28 Feb 2023 08:39:46 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "Elastic key rotation resumed successfully"
}

Get Key Rotation List

Use this endpoint to fetch the history of key rotations performed on a tenant.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{SpectraURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation

Parameters

This endpoint requires the following parameters in the request body:

  • type: Set this to vault_token

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. NOT_FOUND indicates that the search terms do not exist in the data store.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the task id.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/key_rotation"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/key_rotation HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateMon, 16 Jan 2023 08:38:10 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "guid": "kr:d0c5fd14-8ff6-42bc-ac8e-52413eeb26c5",
            "status": "STARTED",
            "type": "KEY_ROTATION",
            "schema_name": "example_schema",
            "created_by": "system",
            "created_at": "2022-12-06T10:00:48.285+00:00",
            "updated_at": "2022-12-06T10:00:48.285+00:00"
        }
    ]
}

Collection Endpoints

The Collection endpoints lets you create a collection (essentially the schema for a document), store documents, create release name that let you view the retrieved document, fetch documents, and search through the documents.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Create a collection
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Update an existing collection
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/release_schema/{collection_name}/{release_name} Create a release name
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/?refresh=true Add data to a collection
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{document_id}?refresh=true Update data in a collection
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search Search for data in a collection
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search/?view={release_name} Search for data in a collection using a release name. Best practice is to use the {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search/{release_name}If you have existing code that already utilises this endpoint ({{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search/?view={release_name}), continue doing so.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search/{release_name} Search for data in a collection using a release name
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id} Fetch a document using document ID
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id}?view={release_name} Fetch a document using a specified release name. Best practice is to use the {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{document_id}/{release_name}If you have existing code that already utilises this endpoint ({{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{document_id}?view={release_name}), continue doing so.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id}/{release_name} Fetch a document using a specified release name.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections Fetch data in all collections
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Delete collection
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/release_schema/{collection_name}/{release_name} Delete a release name
DELETE {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id} Delete a document using it’s document ID

Supported Data Types

Vault lets you encrypt, store, decrypt, and search the following data types. Each Vault endpoint can support all or some of these data types. See the endpoint description for any limitations.

Create Collection

The Collection endpoints lets you create a collection (essentially the schema for a document).

Quick Reference

Data Type FIPS Compliant Search Types Description
keyword Yes Term, Prefix (max 21 characters), Suffix (max 21 characters) A string with a maximum length of 708 characters
keyword_compact Yes Term A string with a maximum length of 24543 characters. When tangled, keyword_compact uses less space compared to the keyword data type. This data_type supports wildcard search. If you want to perform a prefix search, you must use the max_fragments field.
text Yes Match_phrase, Match_phrase_prefi, Match_phrase_suffix
A large string
integer No Term, Range A signed 32-bit integer with a minimum value of -2^31 and a maximum value of (2^31)-1
ip No Term, Term CIDR IP address. Can be of the IPV4 or IPV6 format.
date_no_millis No Term, Range Date in the following format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss. For example: 2021-03-14 23:45:12.
HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Create a collection

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body. The mappings or schema for the document must include a field name and a data type. The data_type must be one of the types supported by Vault.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • COLLECTION_EXISTS indicates that you have specified an existing collection name. If you intend to version a collection, ensure that you specify the version in the collection name. Vault does not version collections.
    • INVALID_TYPES indicates that you have specified an invalid data type for a field.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
	  "compact_name": {
        "type": "keyword_compact"
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "employee_id": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "keyword"
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "integer"
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "recent_review": {
        "type" : "text"
      }
    }
  }
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen"
