{
    "code": "INVALID_TYPE",
    "message": "Invalid type: [1234]"
}

Create Nested Collection

You can use this endpoint to create a collection with nested and object fields.

  • An object field includes all related information regarding a single object. For example, information about an author such as name, age, address, and so on.
  • A nested field includes multiple objects. For example, a list of authors is a nested field.

For more information, see Nested and Object Fields.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Create a collection

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body. The mappings or schema for the document must include a field name and a data type. The data_type must be one of the types supported by Vault. Use nested for list of multiple objects and use object for information related to a single object.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • COLLECTION_EXISTS indicates that you have specified an existing collection name. If you intend to version a collection, ensure that you specify the version in the collection name. Vault does not version collections.
    • INVALID_TYPES indicates that you have specified an invalid data type for a field.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
        "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "name": {
            "type": "keyword"
            },
            "account": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
                "account_id": {
                "type": "keyword"
                },
                "account_number": {
                "type": "keyword"
                }
            }
            },
            "address": {
            "type": "nested",
            "properties": {
                "address_id": {
                "type": "keyword"
                },
                "area": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                    "street_name": {
                    "type": "keyword"
                    },
                    "pin_code": {
                    "type": "integer"
                    }
                }
                }
            }
            }
        }
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplenested1"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplenested1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
        "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "name": {
            "type": "keyword"
            },
            "account": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
                "account_id": {
                "type": "keyword"
                },
                "account_number": {
                "type": "keyword"
                }
            }
            },
            "address": {
            "type": "nested",
            "properties": {
                "address_id": {
                "type": "keyword"
                },
                "area": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                    "street_name": {
                    "type": "keyword"
                    },
                    "pin_code": {
                    "type": "integer"

                }

            }
        }
    }

Update Collection

This endpoint lets you update an existing collection.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Update a collection

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body. The mappings or schema for the document must include a field name and a data type. The data_type must be one of the types supported by Vault.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • INVALID_TYPES indicates that you have specified an invalid data type for a field.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "is_married": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "spouse_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "spouse_mobile": {
        "type": "keyword"
      }
    }
  }
}

List All Collections

Use this endpoint to fetch all the collections.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections Returns a list of all collections.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: If you are fetching all collections, the response includes a list of collections and also the release names associated with each collection.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 11:13:00 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "name": "collection_krqqcejabjynrksweuwsftrlc",
            "created_by": "itest",
            "created_at": "2021-09-21T06:23:55.269+00:00",
            "updated_at": "2021-09-21T06:23:55.269+00:00",
            "releases": []
        },
        {
            "name": "employee",
            "created_by": "system",
            "created_at": "2021-10-04T17:15:22.962+00:00",
            "updated_at": "2021-10-04T17:15:22.962+00:00",
            "releases": [
                "analyst_view",
                "exec_view",
                "legal_view"
            ]
        },
        {
            "name": "employee04",
            "created_by": "system",
            "created_at": "2021-10-06T16:08:56.687+00:00",
            "updated_at": "2021-10-06T16:08:56.687+00:00",
            "releases": [
                "analyst_view",
                "exec_view",
                "legal_view",
                "legal_view2",
                "interchange"
            ]
        }
    ]
}

Delete Collection

Use this endpoint to delete a collection.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name} Delete a collection

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • DELETE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "employee_id": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "keyword"
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "integer"
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "recent Review": {
        "type" : "text"
      }
    }
  }
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/example1n"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/example1n HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "employee_id": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "keyword"
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "date_no_millis"
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "integer"
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "keyword"
      },
      "recent Review": {
        "type" : "text"
      }
    }
  }
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 11:30:49 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "Deleted Successfully"
}

Create Release Name

Use this endpoint to create a release schema. Using the release schema you can control how the document fields are displayed when fetching a document. You can configure Spectra to display clear text, tangled, or masked field values.

Note: The release schema is flat even for a collection with nested and object fields.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/{release_schema} Create a release schema. Use this endpoint instead of the deprecated endpoint: v2/collections/{collection_name}/{release_name}

Request Body

Specify the same field names as in a collection. However, for the type field specify one of the following values:

Data Type Description
clear The field value in a document is in clear text in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
tangled The field value in a document is tangled in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
masked The field value in a document is masked in response to a fetch request with the specified release schema. If you do not specify any type, it defaults to masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to show in clear text in the output. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will not mask ‘-’ in the output. “-/” will not mask “-” “/” characters in the output. If you do not specify this field, all characters in the output field are masked. start: This field specifies the start index field.The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the value field has an index 0. The start attribute defaults to 0. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked.
ff1_numeric A numeric encryption using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_numeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_numeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_numeric. In ff1_numeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_alphanumeric An alphanumeric string encrypted using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_alphanumeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_alphanumeric. In ff1_alphanumeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_printable_ascii ASCII printable characters from 33 to 126 are considered as part of the input data and are tangled or encrypted. Any ASCII characters that are outside this range and retained. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
skip The field value is not returned in the response.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
        "formatting_characters":"-",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 3
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak",
        "formatting_characters":"-/",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 3
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "ff1_numeric",
        "formatting_characters":"CVE-",
        "start": 0
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "masked",
        "formatting_characters":"/",
        "start": 2,
        "end":10
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
        "formatting_characters":"-",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 10
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
        "formatting_characters":"/",
        "start": 0,
        "end": 3
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "masked",
        "formatting_characters":"@",
        "start": 0,
        "end":10
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "masked",
        "start": 2,
        "end":3
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "recent_review": {
        "type" : "masked"
      }
    }
  }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen5/admin"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen5/admin HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

      },

      },

      }
    }
  }
}

Create Release Name when Collection is Updated

Use this endpoint to create a release name when a collection is updated with new fields.

Note: The release name for a nested collection is also a flat structure. That is, the release name does not follow nesting. You must list all the fields without any hierarchy. What this means is that, the release name that you specify for a field applies throughout the collection, irrespective of its definition in a collection. For example, you have the following nested collection:

"home address": {
          "type": "nested",
          "properties": {
            "address_id": {
              "type": "keyword"
            },
            "area": {
              "type": "object",
              "properties": {
                "street_name": {
                  "type": "keyword"
                },
                "pin_code": {
                  "type": "integer"
                }
              }
            }
		}
	}
"office address": {
          "type": "nested",
          "properties": {
            "address_id": {
              "type": "keyword"
            },
            "street_name": {
              "type": "object",
              "properties": {
                "block": {
                  "type": "integer"
                },
                "street_name": {
                  "type": "integer"
                }
              }
            }
		}
	}

When you create a release name for this nested collection, any settings you specify for “street_name” will be valid universally, though the “street_name” can have different properties across the objects in the nested collection.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/release_schema/{collection_name}/{release_name} Create a release name. Use this endpoint instead of the deprecated endpoint: v2/collections/{collection_name}/{release_name}

Request Body

Specify all the field names (including the new fields) as in the updated collection. However, for the type field specify one of the following values:

  • clear text: The field value in a document is in clear text in response to a fetch request with the specified release name.
  • tangled: The field value in a document is tangled in response to a fetch request with the specified release name.
  • masked: The field value in a document is masked in response to a fetch request with the specified release name. If you do not specify any type, it defaults to masked.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "employee_id": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "masked"
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "recent_review": {
        "type" : "masked"
      },
      "is_married": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "spouse_name": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "spouse_mobile": {
        "type": "masked"
      }
    }
  }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen/exec_view"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen/exec_view HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "first_name": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "last_name": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "employee_id": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "tax_id":{
        "type" : "masked"
      },
      "gender": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "start_date": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "date_of_birth": {
        "type": "tangled"
      },
      "department": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "street_address": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "city": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "state": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "zip": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "phone": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "work_email": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "personal_email": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "annual_salary": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "employee_type": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "recent_review": {
        "type" : "masked"
      },
      "is_married": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "spouse_name": {
        "type": "masked"
      },
      "spouse_mobile": {
        "type": "masked"
      }
    }
  }
}
  • Response

                    "type": "clear"
                },

                    "type": "masked"

                    "type": "masked"
                },
                "spouse_mobile": {
                    "type": "masked"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

Update Release Name

Use this endpoint to update an existing release name when a collection is updated with new fields or if you intend to update the type of a field. You can supply only the changed fields as part of the request.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/release_schema/{collection_name}/{release_name} Update an existing release name. Use this endpoint instead of the deprecated endpoint: v2/collections/{collection_name}/{release_name}

Request Body

Specify all the field names (including the new fields) as in the updated collection. However, for the type field specify one of the following values:

  • clear text: The field value in a document is in clear text in response to a fetch request with the specified release name.
  • tangled: The field value in a document is tangled in response to a fetch request with the specified release name.
  • masked: The field value in a document is masked in response to a fetch request with the specified release name. If you do not specify any type, it defaults to masked.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • INVALID_RELEASE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid field name.
    • COLLECTION_NOT_EXISTS: indicates that you have specified an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "is_married": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "spouse_name": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "spouse_mobile": {
        "type": "clear"
      }
    }
  }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen2/exec_view"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen2/exec_view HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "mappings": {
    "properties" : {
      "is_married": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "spouse_name": {
        "type": "clear"
      },
      "spouse_mobile": {
        "type": "clear"
      }
    }
  }
}
  • Update Release Name
  • Update Release Name: Error Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateFri, 21 Jan 2022 08:11:28 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "mappings": {
            "properties": {
                "is_married": {
                    "type": "clear"
                },
                "spouse_name": {
                    "type": "clear"
                },
                "spouse_mobile": {
                    "type": "clear"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
Status404 Not Found
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked

Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "COLLECTION_NOT_EXISTS",
    "message": "Collection [examplen29] not exists"
}

Delete Release Name

Use this endpoint to delete an existing release name.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/release_schema/{collection_name}/{release_name} Delete an existing release name. Use this endpoint instead of the deprecated endpoint: v2/collections/{collection_name}/{release_name}

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • DELETE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The input mappings is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen/analyst_view"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/release_schema/collections/examplen/analyst_view HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Delete Release Name
  • Error:Delete Release Name
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 05 Jan 2022 11:27:26 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "Deleted Successfully"
}
Status404 Not Found
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 05 Jan 2022 11:27:48 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "RELEASE_NOT_EXISTS",
    "message": "Release [analyst_view1] not exists for [examplen] collection"
}

Add Data

Use this endpoint to store a document under a collection in Vault. The data must include the fields mentioned in the collection schema.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc Store document

Parameters

The parameters must be passed as the JSON body. The JSON body includes the field and value pairs as mentioned in the collection.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • STORE_FAILED indicates that value you have specified and the data type of a field do not match.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns doc_id.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "first_name": "Melvyn",
    "last_name": "Todman",
    "employee_id": "af54374e-c7c6-4ceb-8f29-85508beff3a9",
    "tax_id": "749-20-1445",
    "gender": "Male",
    "start_date": "2015-01-07 00:00:00",
    "date_of_birth": "2020-01-03 00:00:00",
    "department": "Heavy Engineering",
    "street_address": "7781 Kropf Street",
    "city": "Stockton",
    "state": "California",
    "zip": "95298",
    "phone": "209-764-6443",
    "personal_email": "mtodman0@nbcnews.com",
    "work_email": "Melvyn.Todman~acme.com",
    "annual_salary": 49643,
    "employee_type": "Fulltime",
    "recent_review":"Self-motivated team member..."}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen6/_doc/?refresh=true"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen6/_doc/?refresh=true HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "first_name": "Melvyn",
    "last_name": "Todman",
    "employee_id": "af54374e-c7c6-4ceb-8f29-85508beff3a9",
    "tax_id": "749-20-1445",
    "gender": "Male",
    "start_date": "2015-01-07 00:00:00",
    "date_of_birth": "2020-01-03 00:00:00",
    "department": "Heavy Engineering",
    "street_address": "7781 Kropf Street",
    "city": "Stockton",
    "state": "California",

    "work_email": "Melvyn.Todman~acme.com",
    "annual_salary": 49643,
    "employee_type": "Fulltime",
    "recent_review":"Self-motivated team member..."}

Update Data

Use this endpoint to update an existing document. If your collection schema has changed and there are new fields, you can use this method to update only the fields that have changed.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id}?refresh=true Update an existing document

Parameters

The parameters must be passed as the JSON body. The JSON body includes the field and value pairs as mentioned in the collection.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • UPDATE_FAILED indicates that value you have specified and the data type of a field do not match or the document with the specified ID does not exist in the collection.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "first_name": "Melvyn",
    "last_name": "Todman",
    "employee_id": "af54374e-c7c6-4ceb-8f29-85508beff3a9",
    "tax_id": "749-20-1445",
    "gender": "Male",
    "start_date": "2015-01-07 00:00:00",
    "date_of_birth": "2020-01-03 00:00:00",
    "department": "Heavy Engineering",
    "street_address": "7781 Kropf Street",
    "city": "Stockton",
    "state": "California",
    "zip": "95298",
    "phone": "209-764-6443",
    "personal_email": "mtodman0@nbcnews.com",
    "work_email": "Melvyn.Todman@acme.com",
    "annual_salary": 60000,
    "employee_type": "Fulltime",
    "recent_review":"Self-motivated team member..."}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen/_doc/bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4?refresh=true"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7Dv2/collections/examplen/_doc/bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4?refresh=true HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

    "first_name": "Melvyn",
    "last_name": "Todman",
    "employee_id": "af54374e-c7c6-4ceb-8f29-85508beff3a9",

Delete Document

Use this endpoint to delete a document using its document id.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id} Delete a document based on document ID.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • DELETE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • input:
    • id: Returns the input document ID.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '

' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen/_doc/3JQ4Kn4BGdCPACss3f-W"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen/_doc/3JQ4Kn4BGdCPACss3f-W HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Delete Document
  • Error: Delete Document
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 05 Jan 2022 12:32:05 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "Deleted successfully",
    "input": {
        "_id": "3JQ4Kn4BGdCPACss3f-W"
    }
}

Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 05 Jan 2022 12:33:45 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "DELETE_FAILED",
    "message": "Delete failed: [method [DELETE], host [http://172.32.67.193:9200], URI [/examplen/_doc/3JQ4Kn4BGdCPACss3f], status line [HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found]\n{\"_index\":\"examplen\",\"_type\":\"_doc\",\"_id\":\"3JQ4Kn4BGdCPACss3f\",\"_version\":1,\"result\":\"not_found\",\"_shards\":{\"total\":2,\"successful\":1,\"failed\":0},\"_seq_no\":12,\"_primary_term\":50}]"
}

Search Documents in a Collection Using Release Name in the Query

Use this endpoint to search for a document in the collection. All search methods as described by Elasticsearch 7.9 are supported by Vault. When you search for a document, you can specify a release name or not. If you specify a release name, the result is displayed based on the release name. If no release name is specified, the results are masked.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search?view={release_name} Search for documents in a collection using a specified release name
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_search Search for documents in a collection

Parameters

Pass the parameters as a JSON body to the request.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • SEARCH_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid search type or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: The document that matches the search time is displayed. If you specify a release name, the result is displayed based on the release name. If no release name is specified, the results are masked.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '
{
  "query": {
    "term": {
      "state":"California"
    }
  }
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen/_search?view=analyst_view"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen/_search?view=analyst_view HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json


{
  "query": {
    "term": {
      "state":"California"
    }
  }
}
  • Wildcard Search
  • Boolean Search
  • Search Term using Release Name
  • Search 01
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 12:33:42 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

Search Documents in a Collection using Release Name in Path

Use this endpoint to search for a document in the collection. All search methods as described by Elasticsearch 7.9 are supported by Vault. When you search for a document, you can specify a release name or not. If you specify a release name, the result is displayed based on the release name. If no release name is specified, the results are masked.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collectionName}/_search/{release_name} Search for documents in a collection using a specified release name

Parameters

Pass the parameters as a JSON body to the request.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

* code: Specifies the response return code. * SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
SEARCH_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid search type or an invalid collection name.

* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
result: The document that matches the search time is displayed. If you specify a release name, the result is displayed based on the release name. If no release name is specified, the results are masked.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" POST -d '{
    "query": {
    "bool": {
      "must": [
         {
          "term": {
            "first_name": "Melvyn"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen/_search/analyst_view"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen/_search/analyst_view HTTP/1.1
Host: 

{
    "query": {
    "bool": {
      "must": [
         {
          "term": {
            "first_name": "Melvyn"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
  • Term Search
  • Wildcard Search
  • Boolean Search

Fetch

Use this endpoint to fetch a document using its document id.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id} Fetch a document based on document ID.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result:
    • Document: Returns the document with masked field values.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen/_doc/bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen/_doc/bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Fetch
  • Fetch Error
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 10:57:22 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "_id": "bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4",
            "zip": "xxxxxxxx",
            "street_address": "xxxxxxxx",
            "work_email": "xxxxxxxx",
            "gender": "xxxxxxxx",
            "city": "xxxxxxxx",
            "date_of_birth": "xxxxxxxx",

            "state": "xxxxxxxx",

            "start_date": "xxxxxxxx"
        }
    ]
}

    "code": "RETRIEVE_FAILED",
    "message": "Retrieve failed: [method [GET], host [http://172.32.67.193:9200], URI [/example12/_doc/bZFcwXwBdLEh7s_MlEK4], status line [HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found]\n{\"error\":{\"root_cause\":[{\"type\":\"index_not_found_exception\",\"reason\":\"no such index [example12]\",\"resource.type\":\"index_expression\",\"resource.id\":\"example12\",\"index_uuid\":\"_na_\",\"index\":\"example12\"}],\"type\":\"index_not_found_exception\",\"reason\":\"no such index [example12]\",\"resource.type\":\"index_expression\",\"resource.id\":\"example12\",\"index_uuid\":\"_na_\",\"index\":\"example12\"},\"status\":404}]"
}

Fetch Using a Release Name as a Query Parameter

Use this endpoint to fetch a document using its document id and a release name in the query parameter.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id}?view={release_name} Fetch a document and display the document fields based on the specified release name.

Parameters

Parameter Required Supported Values
view Optional Specify a release name. A release name defines how the output is displayed.

Response

* This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
* code: Specifies the response return code.
* SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
* RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
* result: Document: The release schema specified with the view parameter defines how the output is displayed. For example, you can create a release name that can fetch the entire data in clear text or some fields in a tangled format. If no release name is specified, all the field values in the fetched document are masked.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen2/_doc/A1pdU4UB8m__R1uXvBBI/admin"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen2/_doc/A1pdU4UB8m__R1uXvBBI/admin HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Fetch - Analyst
  • Fetch - Exec
  • Fetch Using a Release Name - ff1
  • Fetch Using a Release Name as a Query Parameter
  • Fetch Using a Release Name as a Query Parameter
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 11:19:54 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

Fetch Using a Release Name as a Path Parameter

Use this endpoint to fetch a document using its document id and the release name as a path parameter.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/{collection_name}/_doc/{doc_id}/{release_name} Fetch a document and display the document fields based on the specified release name.

Response

* This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
* code: Specifies the response return code.
* SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
* RETRIEVE_FAILED indicates that you have specified an invalid document ID or an invalid collection name.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
* result: Document: The release name specified with the view parameter defines how the output is displayed. For example, you can create a release name that can fetch the entire data in clear text or some fields in a tangled format. If no release name is specified, all the field values in the fetched document are masked.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" GET "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/collections/examplen1/_doc/_CfZG4AB9wP75g9lVknm/analyst_view"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/collections/examplen1/_doc/_CfZG4AB9wP75g9lVknm/analyst_view HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 09 Nov 2022 08:08:16 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "_id": "_CfZG4AB9wP75g9lVknm",
            "zip": "95298",
            "street_address": "xxxxxxxx",
            "work_email": "xxxxxxxx",
            "gender": "Male",
            "city": "Stockton",
            "date_of_birth": "AdT43fsAABAaAAABgBvZVuUueUudDPBI4KGzeG76d0rqPctdfnORZac+Yrh+fPlxvg==",
            "last_name": "AZGWWJkAABAbAAABgBvZVuVqJbzjJOBZAuhh9IC6LMyz",
            "compact_name": "This sentence has to be more than 32 characters long and is going to throw an error when I ingest this data into the index",
            "tax_id": "xxxxxxxx",
            "employee_type": "Fulltime",
            "recent_review": "xxxxxxxx",
            "phone": "xxxxxxxx",
            "employee_id": "xxxxxxxx",
            "annual_salary": 49643,
            "state": "California",
            "department": "Heavy Engineering",
            "first_name": "AYYte2gAABAlAAABgBvZVuY3MZLlxpBQZkQet2GVGc0M",
            "personal_email": "xxxxxxxx",
            "start_date": "2015-01-07 00:00:00"
        }
    ]
}

Titaniam Vault’s AWS S3 Endpoints

The S3 proxy secure endpoints to process (store, retrieve, and delete) parsed and unparsed data in an S3 bucket.

Parsed data refers to structured data provided as a string or as a file. Example of parsed data include JSON fields and JSON files. When processing parsed data, you can also use a schema. Schema defines properties for fields in the parsed data. For example, we can declare a parsed field as type tangled; this means that the Titaniam server will store that particular parsed field in an encrypted format in the s3 bucket. You can do the following operations:

  • Store parsed data
  • Retrieve parsed data as files
  • Retrieve parsed data in the response body

Unparsed data refers to unstructured data such as plain text strings or binary files (such as images, audio files, video files, and so on). You can do the following operations:

  • Store unparsed data provided as in the request body
  • Store unparsed files
  • Retrieve unparsed data as files
  • Retrieve unparsed data in the response body

Quick Reference for Unparsed Data

The following endpoints are provided to process unparsed data as files in an S3 bucket.

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/upload Securely upload an unparsed file.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/generate/upload Get an ephemeral link for uploading files.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/unparsed-upload Upload files to S3 using an ephemeral link.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign Generate an ephemeral link for downloading files.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download-presign Download file using a presigned URL.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download Download an unparsed file.

The following endpoints are provided to process unparsed data as strings in an S3 bucket.

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/store?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store unparsed strings.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/retrieve?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname}&view={clear or tangled} Retrieve the unparsed strings corresponding to the specified key. You can choose to retrieve the data in clear text or tangled text (default).

Quick Reference for Parsed Data Encrypted as Individual Fields

Use the following endpoints to process parsed fields. In these endpoints, each field in the parsed data is individually encrypted.

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store parsed fields in S3.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Create a schema to use with the parsed files or parsed fields.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname}&schema={schema_name}&version={version_name} Retrieve parsed fields from S3.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields/download Download parsed fields.

Quick Reference for Parsed Data Encrypted as a Whole String

Use the following endpoints to process parsed data. In the parsed endpoints, the entire content is encrypted as a string. Whereas, in the parsed-fields endpoints, each field is individually encrypted.

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store parsed data in S3.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Create a schema to use with the parsed data
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname}&schema={schema_name}&version={version_name} Retrieve parsed data from S3.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed/download Download parsed content.

Quick Reference for Deleting and Listing Objects

Use the following endpoints to delete or list objects using the key.

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/delete?bucket={bucket_name}&key={key} Delete an unparsed object.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/list?bucket={bucket_name}&prefix={file_prefix}&size={number_of_objects} Retrieve a list of objects stored in the S3 bucket.

Store Unparsed Strings

This endpoint lets you upload unparsed data securely to an S3 bucket.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/store?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store unparsed strings

Parameters

Include the parameters as search query. The input data is provided in the request body. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. The Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this bucket name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the name under which the unparsed data is stored in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve a the unparsed data, you must use this key.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the unparsed file. e-tag is like an ID of the unparsed file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d 'Hello Titaniam' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/store?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=unparsed.data"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/store?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=unparsed.data HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

Hello Titaniam
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 31 Mar 2022 05:12:05 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "request-charged": "",
        "e-tag": "\"f3be3f857f3975466adcb40d4f9e7041\""
    }
}

Retrieve Unparsed Strings

This endpoint lets you retrieve the unparsed data using the key from an s3 bucket.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/retrieve?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname}&view={clear or tangled} Retrieve the unparsed strings corresponding to the specified key. You can choose to retrieve the data in clear text or tangled text (default).

Parameters

Include the parameters as a form data. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. The Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this bucket name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the name under which the unparsed data is stored in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve the unparsed data, you must use this key.
view Specifies how the data is retrieved: as clear text or in tangled format.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, if the content type is not supported.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the unparsed file. e-tag is like an ID of the unparsed file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/retrieve?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=unparsed.data&view=clear"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/retrieve?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=unparsed.data&view=clear HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/octet-stream
Content-Length14
DateThu, 31 Mar 2022 05:16:31 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

Upload Unparsed File

This endpoint lets you upload unparsed data securely to an S3 bucket.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/upload Secure an unparsed file

Parameters

Include the parameters as a form data. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. The Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this bucket name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the name under which the unparsed file is stored in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve a link to the unparsed file or download the unparsed file, you must use this key.
file Specifies the unparsed file that you want to upload and secure in the S3 bucket.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the unparsed file. e-tag is like an ID of the unparsed file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/upload"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/upload HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Secure Upload
  • Secure Upload: Error Response
  • Secure Upload: Bucket Does Not exist Error Copy
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 06:30:17 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "request-charged": "",
        "e-tag": "\"7c4ce128d54153c0393ec31f2e1a2de4\""
    }
}

    "code": "ERROR",
    "message": "Required request part 'file' is not present"
}

    "code": "ERROR",

}

Get Ephemeral Link for Upload

This endpoint lets you generate a temporary link that you can use to upload a binary file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/generate/upload Generate a temporary link to upload an unparsed file.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the object name corresponding to the binary file in the S3 bucket.
durationSeconds Specifies the duration in seconds. The temporary link to the binary file is active for the specified duration.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns the following fields:
    • durationSeconds: Duration for which the temporary URL is active.
    • pre-sign-URL: URL to upload the binary file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "durationSeconds": "180"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/generate/upload"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/presign/generate/upload HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "durationSeconds": "180"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 06:50:02 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "pre-signed-url": "https://binary-upload-customer1.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/Seoul.png?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20220330T065002Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=180&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAWG3G2WLZ5LMYH2QH%2F20220330%2Fus-east-2%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=7ed9f0f6f3211f88ce6db76fa43297b4ef0bc8f2e8f4599cf748def54541a69e",
        "durationSeconds": "180"
    }
}

Upload Unparsed File using Ephemeral Link

This endpoint lets you upload unparsed file securely to an S3 bucket using an ephemeral link.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/unparsed-upload Upload an unparsed file using the ephemeral link

Parameters

Include the parameters as a body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
presignedUrl Specify the Presigned URL (that you generated using the {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/generate/upload endpoint) to upload the data to S3
key Specifies the name under which the unparsed file is stored in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve a link to the unparsed file or download the unparsed file, you must use this key.
durationSeconds Specifies the duration in seconds. The temporary link to the binary file is active for the specified duration.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the unparsed file. e-tag is like an ID of the unparsed file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign/unparsed-upload"
