Get Ephemeral Link for Download

This endpoint lets you generate a temporary link to the binary file. You can configure the duration for which the link is active.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign Generate a temporary link to the unparsed file.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the object name corresponding to the binary file in the S3 bucket.
durationSeconds Specifies the duration in seconds. The temporary link to the binary file is active for the specified duration.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns the following fields:
    • durationSeconds: Duration for which the temporary URL is active.
    • pre-sign-URL: URL to download the binary file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "durationSeconds": "180"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/presign HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "durationSeconds": "180"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 06:50:02 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "pre-signed-url": "https://binary-upload-customer1.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/Seoul.png?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20220330T065002Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=180&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAWG3G2WLZ5LMYH2QH%2F20220330%2Fus-east-2%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=7ed9f0f6f3211f88ce6db76fa43297b4ef0bc8f2e8f4599cf748def54541a69e",
        "durationSeconds": "180"
    }
}

Download Unparsed File using Presigned URL

This endpoint lets you generate a presigned URL that you can use to download the binary file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}//v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download-presign Use the ephemeral link to generate a presign URL.

Parameters

Include the ephemeral link ((that you generated using the {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/presign endpoint)) as body in the request. You must supply the following parameters as part of request body.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • 200 OK indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the link is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns the file. You can download the file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download-presign"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download-presign HTTP/1.1
Host:

Download Unparsed File

This endpoint lets you securely download the unparsed file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download Download the unparsed file.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the object name corresponding to the unparsed file in the S3 bucket.
view Specifies if the unparsed file must be downloaded in the encrypted or unencrypted format. Supported values are clear (unencrypted format) and tangled (encrypted format)

Response

If the request is successful, the unparsed file is returned. You will be prompted to save the file.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • A status 404 Not Found is returned if the specified file does not exist on the S3 bucket.
    • ERROR: If any parameters are incorrectly specified in the request. A 500 Internal Server Error is returned.
  • message: A verbose message corresponding to the ERROR is returned. For example, if an unsupported view type is specified in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "view": "clear"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/unparsed/download HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
    "key": "Seoul.png",
    "view": "clear"
}

Create Schema for Parsed Data

This endpoint lets you create a schema on the Titaniam server. You can use this schema endpoint to retrieve JSON files from the S3 bucket.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{version} Create Schema.

Parameters

You must pass the path parameters. The schema must be mentioned as a JSON body in the request:

Parameter Description
schema_name Specify the schema name.
version Specify the schema version.

Supported Types

When creating a schema, you must specify the field type for each field. The type determines how the fields in the JSON file are displayed when you retrieve the JSON file from the S3 bucket.

Data Type Description
clear The field value in a document is in clear text in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
tangled The field value in a document is tangled in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
masked The field value in a document is masked in response to a fetch request with the specified release schema. If you do not specify any type, it defaults to masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to show in clear text in the output. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will not mask ‘-’ in the output. “-/” will not mask “-” “/” characters in the output. If you do not specify this field, all characters in the output field are masked. start: This field specifies the start index field.The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the value field has an index 0. The start attribute defaults to 0. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked.
ff1_numeric A numeric encryption using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_numeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_numeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_numeric. In ff1_numeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_alphanumeric An alphanumeric string encrypted using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_alphanumeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_alphanumeric. In ff1_alphanumeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_printable_ascii ASCII printable characters from 33 to 126 are considered as part of the input data and are tangled or encrypted. Any ASCII characters that are outside this range and retained. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
Response

* This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
* code: Specifies the response return code.
* SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
* SCHEMA_EXISTS: indicates that the schema exists. Either supply a new schema name or supply a new version if you intend to keep the schema name.
* INVALID_TYPE: indicates that you have specified an invalid type for a field. Check for typos in the “type” for each field.
* ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
* result: Returns the schema.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "date": {
                "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "transaction_id": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "amount": {
                "type": "masked",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "employee_name": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "employee_id": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "personal_email": {
                "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "work_email": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "salary": {
                "type": "tangled"
            }
        }
    }
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/schema/jsonuser3/3.0"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/schema/jsonuser3/3.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "date": {
                "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "transaction_id": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "amount": {
                "type": "masked",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "employee_name": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "employee_id": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "personal_email": {
                "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "work_email": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "salary": {
                "type": "tangled"
            }
        }
    }
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositioninline;filename=f.txt
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateTue, 01 Mar 2022 10:26:19 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "date": {
                "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "transaction_id": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "amount": {
                "type": "masked",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "employee_name": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "employee_id": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "personal_email": {
                "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "work_email": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "salary": {
                "type": "tangled"
            }
        }
    }
}

Store Parsed JSON Fields

This endpoint lets you store parsed data in the S3 bucket. Each field is individually encrypted.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store parsed fields

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters. The input data is passed in the request body.

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key The data in the request is stored with this key in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve this data, you must supply this key.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the JSON file. e-tag is like an ID of the JSON data.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "first_name": "John2",
  "last_name": "Doe2"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test003.json"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test003.json HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "first_name": "John2",
  "last_name": "Doe2"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 13:12:08 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "request-charged": "",
        "e-tag": "\"0a957e0e9903efbca0cd3f9071e36442\""
    }
}

Retrieve Parsed Fields

This endpoint lets you retrieve parsed fields from the S3 bucket. Before using this endpoint, ensure that you have created a valid schema. Schema defines how the parsed fields are displayed in the response.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/parsed-fields?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname.json}&schema={schema_name}&version={schema_version} Retrieve parsed fields.

Parameters

You must pass the following query parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key keyidentifies the parsed fields that you want to retrieve from the S3 bucket.
schema Specify the schema to use when retrieving the parsed fields. Schema decides how to display the fields in the response. For example, if the schema declares a field (last_name) of type “tangled_keyword”, the field last_name in the response the field value is encrypted.
version Specify the schema version that you want to use when retrieving the parse fields.

Response

This endpoint returns the parsed fields.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test003.json&schema=jsonuser3&version=3.0"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test003.json&schema=jsonuser3&version=3.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length44
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 13:13:46 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "first_name": "xxxxxxxx",
    "last_name": "Doe2"
}

Download Parsed Fields as File

This endpoint lets you download parsed fields from the S3 bucket. Before using this endpoint, ensure that you have created a valid schema. Schema defines how the parsed fields are displayed in the response.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/parsed-fields/download Download the parsed fields as a file.

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters in the request body:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key keyidentifies the parsed fields that you want to retrieve from the S3 bucket.
schema Specify the schema to use when retrieving the parsed fields. Schema decides how to display the fields in the response. For example, if the schema declares a field (last_name) of type “tangled_keyword”, the field last_name in the response the field value is encrypted.
version Specify the schema version that you want to use when retrieving the parse fields.

Response

This endpoint returns the parsed fields.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
  "key": "test003.json",
  "schema": "jsonuser3",
  "schemaVersion": 3.0
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields/download"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed-fields/download HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
  "key": "test003.json",
  "schema": "jsonuser3",
  "schemaVersion": 3.0
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositionattachment; filename="test003.json"
cache-controlno-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Content-Typeapplication/octet-stream
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 31 Mar 2022 06:19:52 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "first_name": "xxxxxxxx",
    "last_name": "Doe2"
}

Store Parsed Data

This endpoint lets you store parsed data in the S3 bucket. The entire content is encrypted as a whole string.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname} Store parsed data

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters. The input data is passed in the request body.

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key The data in the request is stored with this key in the S3 bucket. When you want to retrieve this data, you must supply this key.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag of the JSON file. e-tag is like an ID of the JSON data.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
    "first_name": "Shawn@",
    "last_name": "Michaels",
    "date_of_birth": "08-15-1978",
    "annual_salary": 12312,
    "password": "test1234"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test006.json"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test006.json HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "first_name": "Shawn@",
    "last_name": "Michaels",
    "date_of_birth": "08-15-1978",
    "annual_salary": 12312,
    "password": "test1234"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 31 Mar 2022 04:50:29 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "request-charged": "",
        "e-tag": "\"f26352f659aa9b2ea5975204c97e2f97\""
    }
}

Retrieve Parsed Data

This endpoint lets you retrieve parsed data from the S3 bucket. Before using this endpoint, ensure that you have created a valid schema. Schema defines how the parsed fields are displayed in the response.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/parsed?bucket={bucketname}&key={keyname.json}&schema={schema_name}&version={schema_version} Retrieve parsed data.

Parameters

You must pass the following query parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key keyidentifies the parsed fields that you want to retrieve from the S3 bucket.
schema Specify the schema to use when retrieving the parsed fields. Schema decides how to display the fields in the response. For example, if the schema declares a field (last_name) of type “tangled_keyword”, the field last_name in the response the field value is encrypted.
version Specify the schema version that you want to use when retrieving the parse fields.

Response

This endpoint returns the parsed fields.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test007.json&schema=jsonuser3&version=4.0"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=test007.json&schema=jsonuser3&version=4.0 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length66
DateThu, 31 Mar 2022 06:46:43 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "first_name": "zEB4t@",
    "last_name": "aKnWIU3T",
    "date_of_birth": "02-97-5559",
    "annual_salary": "92739",
    "password": "A{*_pXOX"
}

Download Parsed Data as File

This endpoint lets you retrieve parsed data from the S3 bucket. Before using this endpoint, ensure that you have created a valid schema. Schema defines how the parsed fields are displayed in the response.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed/download Retrieve parsed data.

Parameters

You must pass the following query parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key keyidentifies the parsed data that you want to retrieve from the S3 bucket.
schema Specify the schema to use when retrieving the parsed data. Schema decides how to display the fields in the response. For example, if the schema declares a field (last_name) of type “tangled_keyword”, the field last_name in the response the field value is encrypted.
version Specify the schema version that you want to use when retrieving the parse data.

Response

This endpoint returns the parsed fields.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
  "key": "test006.json",
  "schema": "parsed",
  "schemaVersion": 3.0
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/parsed/download"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/parsed/download HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "bucket": "binary-upload-customer1",
  "key": "test006.json",
  "schema": "parsed",
  "schemaVersion": 3.0
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositionattachment; filename="test006.json"
cache-controlno-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate

{
    "first_name": "John2",
    "last_name": "03CLy06kIc&&c06NQ!FZl06;RJDdu"
}

Delete Objects

This endpoint lets you delete the unparsed file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/delete?bucket={bucket_name}&key={key} Delete an object in an S3 bucket.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a search query in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
key Specifies the object name corresponding to the unparsed file in the S3 bucket.

Response

If the request is successful, the unparsed file is deleted.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • 404 Not Found: A status 404 Not Found is returned if the specified file does not exist on the S3 bucket.
    • ERROR: If any parameters are incorrectly specified in the request. A 500 Internal Server Error is returned.
    • success: If the delete operation was successful.
  • message: A verbose message corresponding to the ERROR is returned. For example, if an unsupported view type is specified in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/delete?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=Seoul.png"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/delete?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&key=Seoul.png HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

List Objects

This endpoint lets you retrieve a list of objects stored in the S3 bucket.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/list?bucket={bucket_name}&prefix={file_prefix}&size={number_of_objects} List objects from an s3 bucket.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a search query. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the S3 bucket name. The Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. Ensure that this bucket name matches the index name in the bring-your-own-key elasticsearch indexes. The default keys associated with this bucket name are retrieved from the AWS Secrets Manager.
prefix Specifies the prefix to match in the file name
size Specifies the number of objects in the list. You can retrieve up to 1000. This field is an integer.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the keys that match the input parameters.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/list?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&prefix=S&size=1"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/list?bucket=binary-upload-customer1&prefix=S&size=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • List Objects
  • Error: List Objects File Size
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 07:13:27 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "keys": [
            "Seoul.mp4",
            "Seoul.png"
        ],
        "continuation-token": null
    }
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 30 Mar 2022 07:18:58 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "ERROR",
    "message": "Failed to convert value of type 'java.lang.String' to required type 'java.lang.Integer'; nested exception is java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: \"10000000000000000000000000000\""
}

Vault Azure Blob Endpoints

The Titaniam proxy for Azure provides endpoints to process (store, retrieve, and delete) parsed and unparsed data in an Azure container.

Parsed data refers to structured data provided as a string or as a file. Example of parsed data include JSON files. You can do the following operations:

  • Store parsed data
  • Retrieve parsed data

Quick Reference for Parsed Files

Use the following endpoints to process parsed data. In the parsed endpoints, the entire content is encrypted as a string.

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/store/{filename}.json Securely upload a JSON file.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/retrieve/{filename}.json Retrieve a JSON file.

Unparsed data refers to unstructured data such as binary files (such as images, audio files, video files, and so on). You can do the following operations:

  • Store unparsed files in encrypted format
  • Download unparsed files
  • Retrieve unparsed files in clear or tangled format in the response

Quick Reference for Unparsed Data

Use the following endpoints to process unparsed data.

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/upload Upload unparsed files.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/download Download the unparsed file.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/retrieve Retrieve the unparsed file in clear or tangled format.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/presign Get a presigned URL to download the file.

Quick Reference for Binary Files

You can also upload, download binary files. Use the following endpoints to process binary files

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/{container-name}/{blob-name} Store binary file in Azure container.
GETs {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/{container-name}/{blob-name} Download the binary file from the Azure container

Quick Reference for Deleting and Listing Objects

Use the following endpoints to delete or list blobs in the Azure container.

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/delete Delete a blob.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/list?bucket={container_name}&size={number_of_objects}&prefix={file_prefix} Retrieve a list of blobs present in the container.

Store JSON

This endpoint lets you store parsed data in the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/store/{filename}.json Securely upload a JSON file.

Parameters

You must pass the input data is passed in the request body.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the link to this file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "first_name": "John2",
  "last_name": "Doe2"
}' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/store/kpfile.json"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/store/kpfile.json HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "first_name": "John2",
  "last_name": "Doe2"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:34:56 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": "https://titaniamdev.blob.core.windows.net/standalone-test-data?sv=2020-10-02&spr=https&se=2022-05-03T22%3A09%3A20Z&sr=b&sp=rwl&sig=hO4Pl0wD25nVubaKIeB0unsuXb7y%2FNj4uUaGPuEn6PA%3D"
}

Retrieve JSON

This endpoint lets you retrieve parsed data from the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/retrieve/{filename}.json Retrieve a JSON file.

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters:

Parameter Description
filename filenameidentifies the JSON file that you want to retrieve from the Azure container.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns the JSON data.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/retrieve/test-1.json"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/retrieve/test-1.json HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:37:31 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": [
        {
            "firstName": "John",
            "lastName": "Doe",
            "SSN": "608-23-2231"
        },
        {
            "firstName": "Jane",
            "lastName": "Doe",
            "SSN": "608-23-2345"
        }
    ]
}

Unparsed Upload

This endpoint lets you upload unparsed data securely to an Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/upload Upload unparsed files.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a form data. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name.
key Specifies the name under which the unparsed file is stored in the Azure container. When you want to retrieve a link to the unparsed file or download the unparsed file, you must use this key.
file Specifies the unparsed file that you want to upload and encrypt in the Azure container.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the e-tag and version-idof the unparsed file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/upload?bucket=testing10&key=architecture2.png"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/upload?bucket=testing10&key=architecture2.png HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:16:47 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "e-tag": "0x8DA30E43DD170AF",
        "version-id": "2022-05-08T11:16:47.4169279Z"
    }
}

Unparsed Download

This endpoint lets you securely download the unparsed file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/download Download the unparsed file.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name.
key Specifies the blob name corresponding to the unparsed file in the Azure container.
view Specifies if the unparsed file must be downloaded in the encrypted or unencrypted format. Supported values are clear (unencrypted format) and tangled (encrypted format).

Response

If the request is successful, the unparsed file is returned. You will be prompted to save the file.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • A status 404 Not Found is returned if the specified file does not exist on the Azure container bucket.
    • ERROR: If any parameters are incorrectly specified in the request. A 500 Internal Server Error is returned.
    • A 200 OK is returned if the operation was successful. You can download the file.
  • message: A verbose message corresponding to the ERROR is returned. For example, if an unsupported view type is specified in the request.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/download"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/download HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:16:47 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "e-tag": "0x8DA30E43DD170AF",
        "version-id": "2022-05-08T11:16:47.4169279Z"
    }
}

Get Unparsed Presign

This endpoint lets you generate a temporary link to the binary file.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/presign Get a presigned URL to download the file.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a JSON body in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name.
key Specifies the blob name corresponding to the binary file in the Azure container.
view Specifies if the unparsed file must be downloaded in the encrypted or unencrypted format. Supported values are clear (unencrypted format) and tangled (encrypted format).

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Returns the following fields:
    • durationSeconds: Duration for which the temporary URL is active.
    • pre-signed-URL: URL to download the binary file.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/presign"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/presign HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:16:47 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "e-tag": "0x8DA30E43DD170AF",
        "version-id": "2022-05-08T11:16:47.4169279Z"
    }
}

Retrieve Unparsed

This endpoint lets you retrieve the unparsed file as a byte array in a clear or tangled format.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/retrieve Retrieve the unparsed file in clear or tangled format.

Parameters

Include the following query parameters in the request.

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name.
key Specifies the blob name corresponding to the binary file in the Azure container.
view Specifies if the unparsed file must be downloaded in the encrypted or unencrypted format. Supported values are clear (unencrypted format) and tangled (encrypted format).

Response

This blob is returned as a byte array based on the view field.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • A status 404 Not Found is returned if the specified file does not exist on the Azure container bucket.
    • ERROR: If any parameters are incorrectly specified in the request. A 500 Internal Server Error is returned.
    • A 200 OK is returned if the operation was successful. You can download the file.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/retrieve?bucket=testing&key=architecture.png&view=tangled"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/unparsed/retrieve?bucket=testing&key=architecture.png&view=tangled HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Retrieve Unparsed
  • Retrieve Unparsed
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:30:34 GMT
Connectionclose
{
    "code": "ERROR",
    "message": "com.azure.storage.blob.models.BlobStorageException: Status code 404, (BlobNotFound)"
}
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/octet-stream
Content-Length38669

Connectionkeep-alive

Upload File

This endpoint lets you store binary files in the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/{container-name}/{blob-name} Store binary file in Azure container.

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters. The input data is passed in the request body.

Parameter Description
container-name Specify the Azure container name.
blob-name The data in the request is stored with this blob name in the Azure container. When you want to retrieve this data, you must supply this key.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • 200 indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/testing/architecture.png"
PUT %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/testing/architecture.png HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 07:40:44 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "200"
}

Download File

This endpoint lets you retrieve binary files in the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/{container-name}/{blob-name} Download the binary file from the Azure contain

Parameters

You must pass the following parameters.

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name.
blob-name Blob name in the Azure container.

Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • 200 indicates that the request was successful. You must download the file.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the data is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-azure-proxy/testing/architecture.png"

}

Get List

This endpoint lets you retrieve a list of blobs stored in the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/list?bucket={container_name}&size={number_of_objects}&prefix={file_prefix} Retrieve a list of blobs present in the container.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a search query. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Optional/Mandatory Description
bucket Mandatory Specify the Azure container name.
prefix Mandatory Specifies the prefix to match in the file name. If prefix value is empty, the list of objects (with the latest timestamp to the older timestamps are retrieved). Otherwise, the list of objects matching the prefix are listed. The number of blobs listed is determined by the size parameter.
size Mandatory Specifies the number of objects in the list. This field is an integer.

Response

  • This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
    • ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
  • result: Specifies the keys that match the input parameters. If prefix value is empty, the list of objects (with the latest timestamp to the older timestamps are retrieved). Otherwise, the list of objects matching the prefix are listed. The number of blobs listed is determined by the size parameter.
  • continuation_token: A continuation token is returned that can be used to continue “paging” through results and getting next size results. This is useful if there are more blobs (greater than the size) that match the prefix.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/list?bucket=testing&size=3&prefix="
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/list?bucket=testing&size=3&prefix= HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Get List
  • Get List
  • Error: Get List
  • Error: Get List
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:16:05 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "keys": [
            "architecture.png",
            "architecture2.png",
            "architecture3.png"
        ],
        "continuation-token": "2!84!MDAwMDE3IWFyY2hpdGVjdHVyZTQucG5nITAwMDAyOCE5OTk5LTEyLTMxVDIzOjU5OjU5Ljk5OTk5OTlaIQ--"
    }
}
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:05:44 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "keys": [
            "architecture.png"
        ],
        "continuation-token": null
    }
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typeapplication/json

{
    "code": "ERROR",
    "message": "Required request parameter 'prefix' for method parameter type String is not present"
}

{
    "code": "ERROR",
    "message": "Required request parameter 'size' for method parameter type Integer is not present"
}

Delete File

This endpoint lets you delete a blob from the Azure container.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
DELETE {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/delete Delete a blob.

Parameters

Include the parameters as a search query in the request. You must supply the following parameters:

Parameter Description
bucket Specify the Azure container name. Titaniam server retrieves the encryption keys related to this bucket name. The default keys associated with this bucket name are used to connect to the container.
file Specifies the blob name that you want to delete.

Response

If the request is successful, the blob is deleted.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • 404 Not Found: A status 404 Not Found is returned if the specified blob does not exist on the Azure container.
    • ERROR: If any parameters are incorrectly specified in the request. A 500 Internal Server Error is returned.
    • success: If the delete operation was successful. A 200 OK is returned.
  • message: Object Deleted if the deletion was successful. If not, a verbose message related to the code is returned.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
' "{{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/azure/delete?bucket=testing&file=architecture2.png"
DELETE %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/azure/delete?bucket=testing&file=architecture2.png HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json

{	
	"bucket" : "testing10",
	"key" : "architecture2.png",
	"view" : "clear"
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateSun, 08 May 2022 11:28:10 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "success",
    "message": "Object Deleted"
}

Elasticsearch Proxy Endpoints

The Elasticsearch proxy (ESProxy) supports all endpoints supported by Elasticsearch. The advantage of using an ESProxy is that it:

  • Maps the standard data types to secure internal data types.
  • Stores data in a tangled or encrypted format when ingesting documents.
  • Let us search through tangled or encrypted data using the standard search queries and returns data in clear text.
  • Returns data in clear text when you retrieve a document through the proxy.
  • Returns data in encrypted format when you try to directly access the document through Kibana bypassing the proxy.

Supported Data Types

Following are the data types supported by Titaniam Elasticsearch proxy:

Data Type Tangled Types Supported Queries Comments Description
keyword encrypted_keyword_tangled Term, Terms, Prefix, Wildcard Normalizer and norms are not supported.
Wildcard search acts like a prefix search		 A string with a maximum length of 708 characters
text tangled_tiny_text2_tangled Match, Multi Match, Match Phrase, Match Phrase, Prefix
Analyzer is not supported in search queries A large string
integer tangled_integer_tangled Term, Terms, Range A signed 32-bit integer with a minimum value of -2^31 and a maximum value of (2^31)-1
ip tangled_ip_tangled Term, Term CIDR, Terms IP address. Can be of the IPV4 or IPV6 format.
date tangled_date_tangled Term, Terms, Range Date in the following formats: basic_date_time

Create an Index

This endpoint is a standard Elasticsearch endpoint. However, when this endpoint requests passes through the Elasticsearch proxy, the ES proxy internally maps these data types as follows so that when you ingest documents, the data is tangled or encrypted before ingestion.

Data Type Tangled Types
keyword encrypted_keyword_tangled
text tangled_tiny_text2_tangled
integer tangled_integer_tangled
ip tangled_ip_tangled
date tangled_date_tangled
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -d '{
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "cve": {
                "type": "keyword"
            },
            "name": {
                "type": "text"
            },
            "ipv4": {
                "type": "ip"
            },
            "pob": {
                "type": "integer"
            }
        }
    }
}' "http://qa-6-2-2.titaniamlabs.com:8080/double_index/"
PUT /double_index/ HTTP/1.1
Host: qa-6-2-2.titaniamlabs.com:8080

{
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "cve": {
                "type": "keyword"
            },
            "name": {
                "type": "text"
            },
            "ipv4": {
                "type": "ip"
            },
            "pob": {
                "type": "integer"
            }
        }
    }
}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateTue, 27 Dec 2022 04:25:10 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "acknowledged": true,
    "shards_acknowledged": true,
    "index": "double_index"
}

Add a Document

This endpoint is a standard Elasticsearch endpoint. The ESproxy adds a document to an index using the tangled data types.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -d '{
    "cve": "CVE-2077-1514",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "ipv6": "2600:1005:b062:61e4:74d7:f292:802c:fbfd",
    "pob": "10081981"
}' "http://13.234.194.57:8080/double_index/_doc/4"
PUT /double_index/_doc/4 HTTP/1.1
Host: 13.234.194.57:8080

{
    "cve": "CVE-2077-1514",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "ipv6": "2600:1005:b062:61e4:74d7:f292:802c:fbfd",
    "pob": "10081981"
}
  • Response
Status201 Created
location/double_index/_doc/1
Content-Typeapplication/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length160
DateTue, 27 Dec 2022 04:27:43 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "_index": "double_index",
    "_type": "_doc",
    "_id": "1",
    "_version": 1,
    "result": "created",
    "_shards": {
        "total": 2,
        "successful": 1,
        "failed": 0
    },
    "_seq_no": 0,
    "_primary_term": 1
}

Retrieve a Document

This is a standard Elasticsearch endpoint. However, when the data is accessed bypassing the proxy, the data returned is tangled.

Data Returned when Accessed through the Proxy Data Returned when Accessed Bypassing the Proxy
10081981 AQAAAAEAAAGFUeNCFcusEUAIceDXoWJCPt+gstK5roB/

John Doe AQAAAAQAAAGFUeNCF4wMvgMjF1/OJzfh9kaqDM42VNWn

Search for Documents

This is a standard Elasticsearch endpoint. However, the difference is that when displaying the document, the fields are tangled. Following is an example of the input data and returned data. The ESproy lets you search through the tangled or encrypted data using clear search terms.

Data Returned when Accesseed through the Proxy Data Returned when Accessed Bypassing the Proxy
10081981 AQAAAAEAAAGFUeNCFcusEUAIceDXoWJCPt+gstK5roB/

John Doe AQAAAAQAAAGFUeNCF4wMvgMjF1/OJzfh9kaqDM42VNWn

Object Store Protection

Titaniam offers two solutions to protect your object store:

  • Titaniam Proxy for Object store (referred to as Proxy in this document) allows you to protect an object store such as Azure Blob and AWS S3.
  • Data Protection service that lets you encrypt objects in place in the object store.

Titaniam Proxy for Azure Object Store

The Titaniam Proxy for Azure supports all the endpoints as described here.

The PUT Blob and GET Blob endpoints are intercepted by the Titaniam Proxy for Azure and the data is encrypted and decrypted. You can view the data in clear view only if the requests are passed through the Titaniam Proxy for Azure.

Titaniam Proxy for S3 Object Store

The Titaniam Proxy for S3 supports all the AWS S3 endpoints as described here.

The PUTObject and GETObject endpoints are intercepted by the Titaniam Proxy for S3 and the data is encrypted and decrypted. You can view the data in clear view only if the requests are passed through the Titaniam Proxy for S3.

Titaniam Proxy for S3 overloads the PUTObject and GETObject endpoints. Following is a list of overloaded endpoints.

Before using the endpoints, ensure that you have overridden the endpoint URL in your AWS SDK. For more information, see these instructions.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name} Upload an object to an S3 bucket.
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{folder_name}/{sub_folder}/{object_name} Upload an object to a folder in an S3 bucket.
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name}!T!{formatted_payload} Upload an object to an S3 bucket. You can override the region, bucket name by formatting these as payload. Before using this endpoint, generate the formatted payload.
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{schema_version} Create a Schema
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name} Get an object from an S3 bucket
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{folder_name}/{sub_folder}/{object_name} Get an object from a folder in an S3 bucket
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name}!T!{formatted_payload} Get an object from an S3 bucket using a schema. Before using this endpoint, you must generate a formatted payload.
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket={bucket_name}&key={object}Region={region_name} Generate formatted payload

Upload an Object

This endpoint lets you upload an object to an S3 bucket. By default, Titaniam S3 Proxy operates as a “client” to AWS S3 with a default region set to “us-east-2”. Any requests generated assume that buckets and files under buckets are created in the “us-east-2” region. If you want to upload the object to a different region, you must pass the region name as a formatted payload.

Quick Reference
HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name} Upload an object to an S3 bucket in the default region.
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{folder_name}/{object_name} Upload an object to a folder in an S3 bucket in the default region.
PUT {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name}!T!{formatted_payload} Upload an object to a region other than the default region.
Parameters
Parameter Description
bucket_name Specify the S3 bucket name.
object_name Specifies the name under which the object is stored in the S3 bucket.
Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

* code : Specifies the response return code.
* SUCCESS : indicates that the request was successful.
* ERROR: indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" PUT "{{pantherURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer1/sample/samplefile1.json"
PUT %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer1/sample/samplefile1.json HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • PUT Binary Object
  • PUT JSON Object
  • Upload an Object to a folder
Status200 OK
DateThu, 24 Nov 2022 12:35:53 GMT
ServerAmazonS3

x-amz-request-idMGAC67P0Z3DR48BT
Content-Typeapplication/json
Content-Length0

ServerAmazonS3

DateFri, 25 Nov 2022 05:43:44 GMT
ServerAmazonS3
x-amz-id-29gNz6QnWfsua8M21o8Dun2PqUtxYy7RmFcBTUc5GeK42SuT+M4Bu0S69HxBDpHxTTud+pkgvS+sGFtaRp08E4Q==
x-amz-request-idTXMY8FRSMDF1BT5H
Content-Typeapplication/json
Content-Length0
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

Get an Object

This endpoint lets you retrieve an object from an S3 bucket.

Quick Reference
HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/{bucket_name}/{object_name} Retrieve an object to S3.
Parameters
Parameter Description
bucket_name Specify the S3 bucket name.
object_name Specifies the name under which the object is stored in the S3 bucket.
Response

If the retrieval is successful, the object is download to you system. A 200 OK response is received.

In case of an error (404 Not Found or 500 Server Response, the following response is received

* code : Specifies the error code. For example, NoSuchKey indicates that the object name is incorrect. NoSuchBucket indicates that bucket name is incorrect in the request.
* RequestID : indicates the request ID.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" GET "{{pantherURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer100/video12.mp4"
GET %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer100/video12.mp4 HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • GET JSON Object
  • GET Object Error
  • Get an Object Error
Status200 OK
Content-Dispositionattachment; filename="samplefile1.json"
cache-controlno-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Content-Typeapplication/octet-stream
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateThu, 24 Nov 2022 12:42:51 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

    "date": "01-01-2022",
    "transaction_id": "20220101-0000001",
    "amount": 1,
    "employee_name": "Jane Smith",
    "employee_id": "10001",
    "email": "jane@acme.com"

Create Schema

This endpoint lets you create a schema. You can use this schema endpoint to control how the structured objects (JSON) are retrieved from the S3 bucket. The schema specified in the request must conform to the object structure. The structure of the schema, name of fields, their types, and release formats must match the structure of the file stored.

Quick Reference
HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/schema/{schema_name}/{version} Create a schema.
Parameters

You must pass the path parameters. The schema must be mentioned as a JSON body in the request:

Parameter Description
schema_name Specify the schema name.
version Specify the schema version.
Supported Types

When creating a schema, you must specify the field type for each field. The type determines how the fields in the JSON file are displayed when you retrieve the JSON file from the S3 bucket.

Data Type Description
clear The field value in a document is in clear text in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
tangled The field value in a document is tangled in response to a fetch request with the specified schema.
masked The field value in a document is masked in response to a fetch request with the specified release schema. If you do not specify any type, it defaults to masked. You can optionally specify the following attributes as well: formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to show in clear text in the output. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will not mask ‘-’ in the output. “-/” will not mask “-” “/” characters in the output. If you do not specify this field, all characters in the output field are masked. start: This field specifies the start index field.The service will start masking from this index. The first character in the value field has an index 0. The start attribute defaults to 0. end: This field specifies the end index of the value. The service will end masking at this index. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is masked.
ff1_numeric A numeric encryption using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). This field type preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. Also the encrypted value length is equal to the length of the input. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_numeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_numeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_numeric. In ff1_numeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_numeric_no_tweak, the values 123 and 1-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_alphanumeric An alphanumeric string encrypted using a FIPS-compliant format-preserving encryption (FPE). FPE preserves the formatting of the source during encryption. This data type is case sensitive, that is, upper case alphabets are treated as different from lower-case alphabets. Alphabet A to Z (including lower case) are supported. Arabic numerals are supported. When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field. If you do not specify this field, all characters are considered legal in the value field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The translation service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.

For example:
"tax_id":{ "type" : "ff1_alphanumeric", "formatting_characters":"CVE-", "start": 0 "end": 9 }
ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak Similar to ff1_alphanumeric. In ff1_alphanumeric, any allowed characters in the value field are used as salt during encryption. Whereas, in ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the allowed characters are not used as salt during encryption. That is, when you use ff1_alphanumeric_no_tweak, the values Ab23 and A-b-2-3 result in the same numerical output.
ff1_printable_ascii ASCII printable characters from 33 to 126 are considered as part of the input data and are tangled or encrypted. Any ASCII characters that are outside this range and retained. The index of the Value starts from 0 and each index position supports numerals 0 through 9. Any value greater than 1 billion must be specified as a string.
When you specify this type, you can optionally specify the following attributes as well:

formatting_characters: You can specify characters that you want to allow in the input value. You can specify multiple characters in this field. For example “-”, will allow ‘-’ in the input field. “-/” will allow “-” “/” characters in the field.

start: This field specifies the start index field of the value. This field defaults to 0. The service will start tangling starting from this index field. The first character in the value field has an index 0.

end: This field specifies the end index field of the value. The service will end tangling at this index field. If you do not specify end, the entire string starting at the start index is tangled.
Response

* This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:
* code: Specifies the response return code.
* SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
* SCHEMA_EXISTS: indicates that the schema exists. Either supply a new schema name or supply a new version if you intend to keep the schema name.
* INVALID_TYPE: indicates that you have specified an invalid type for a field. Check for typos in the “type” for each field.
* ERROR indicates that an error has occurred. For example, when the file is not included as part of the request or the specified bucket does not exist.
* message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.
* result: Returns the schema.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" POST -d '{
    "mappings": {
        "properties": {
            "date": {
                "type": "ff1_printable_ascii",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "transaction_id": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "amount": {
                "type": "masked",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "employee_name": {
                "type": "clear"
            },
            "employee_id": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 3
            },
            "personal_email": {
                "type": "ff1_alphanumeric",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "work_email": {
                "type": "ff1_numeric_no_tweak",
                "formatting_characters":"-",
                "start": 0,
                "end": 10
            },
            "salary": {
                "type": "tangled"
            }
        }
    }
}' "{{pantherURL}}/schema/legal/4.0"

Host:

Generate Formatted Payload

Use this endpoint to generate a formatted payload. You can then use the payload with the PUTObject and GETObject endpoints. Use this endpoint in the following use cases:

* When you want to use the PUT or GET an object from a different AWS S3 region. By default, the PUT and GET objects work with the default us-west-2 region.
* When you want to specify a release schema on the GET object method on structured data. A release schema defines how the structured data is displayed to the user (for example, clear text, tangled, masked, ff1_numeric encrypted, and so on).

Quick Reference
HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket={bucket_name}&key={object}Region={region_name}&schemaName={schema_name}&schemaVersion={version} Generate formatted payload
Parameters

The following are the query parameters:

Parameter Required? Description
bucket Mandatory Specify the AWS S3 bucket name.
key Mandatory Specify the object name in the S3 bucket.
region Mandatory Specifies the AWS S3 bucket region. Use this parameter if you want to change the S3 bucket region in the PUTObject or GETObject methods.
schemaName Optional Specify the schema name. Use this parameter only if you want to GET an object using a schema.
schemaVersion Optional Specify the schema version. Use this parameter only if you want to GET an object using a schema.
Response

If successful (200 OK), this endpoint returns a formatted payload that you can use with other endpoints. The following is a sample payload:

/bucket_name/key!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0

Where,

* bucket_name indicates the bucket name.
* key indicates the key or object name.
* !T! is the delimiliter that Titaniam Proxy uses to identify the payload. All the text after !T! is the payload.

You must use this entire result as part of the PATH parameters with the PUTObject and GET Object.

A 500 Internal Server Error is returned when you do not specify the mandatory query parameters in the request.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" GET "{{pantherURL}}/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket=integration-test-bucket-2&key=samplefile1.json&schemaName=legal&schemaVersion=4.0"
GET %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket=integration-test-bucket-2&key=samplefile1.json&schemaName=legal&schemaVersion=4.0 HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • Generate Formatted Payload
  • Generate Formatted Payload for PUT
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length153
DateFri, 25 Nov 2022 04:59:54 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length154
DateThu, 24 Nov 2022 14:23:10 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive

PUT Object with Formatted Payload

Use this endpoint to upload objects to an S3 bucket to a specific region (any region other than the default region).

Before using this endpoint, you must do the following sequence:

  1. Generate a formatted payload using this endpoint: {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket={bucket_name}&key={object}Region={region_name}&schemaName={schema_name}&schemaVersion={version}
  2. Copy the result of the formatted payload endpoint. For example: /bucket_name/key!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0
  3. Use the result as a path parameter for the PUTObject endpoint. For example: /v2/titaniam-s3-proxy//bucket_name/key!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0

Response

* If the object is successfully stored, you will see a 200 OK response.
* If the request is unsuccessful, you will see a 500 Internal Server Error.

GET JSON Object With Release Schema and Region

Use this endpoint to retrieve structured objects with a specific release schema.

Before using this endpoint, you must do the following sequence:

  1. Generate a formatted payload using this endpoint: {{secureStoreURL}}/v2/secure/s3/generate-formatted-payload?bucket={bucket_name}&key={object}region={region_name}&schemaName={schema_name}&schemaVersion={version}
  2. Copy the result of the formatted payload endpoint. For example: /bucket_name/key!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0
  3. Use the result as a path parameter for the GETObject endpoint. For example: /v2/titaniam-s3-proxy//bucket_name/key!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0

Response

* If the object is successfully stored, you will see a 200 OK response.
* If the request is unsuccessful, you will see a 500 Internal Server Error.

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X -H "Content-Type: application/json" GET "{{pantherURL}}/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer1/samplefile1.json!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0"
GET %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/binary-upload-customer1/samplefile1.json%21T%21eyJyZWdpb24iOiIiLCJzY2hlbWEiOiJsZWdhbCIsInNjaGVtYVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjAiLCJjdXN0b21lciI6IiIsInZpZXdUeXBlIjoiIn0 HTTP/1.1
