Data Protection for Object Stores

The data protection service for object stores lets you encrypt and decrypt objects in your object stores. Currently, AWS S3 is supported. This service lets you do the following operations:

  • Encrypt an object in-place in the object store. You must pass on the object reference to the data protection service.
  • Retrieve an object from the object store in clear format.

Note: This API is available only if you have set sdss.data.protection.enabled=true during the data-protection service deployment.

Quick Reference for S3 Object Store

HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{baseUrl}}/v1/data-protection/{store-type-name}/object Encrypt an object in-place in the object store.
GET {{baseUrl}}/v1/data-protection/{store-type-name}/object/link?region={region_name}&bucket={bucket_name}&object-key={object_name} Generate an encoded URI or a pre-signed URL to download an object in clear format.

Encrypt an Object in-place in S3

Note: This API is available only if you have set sdss.data.protection.enabled=true during the data-protection service deployment.

This API lets you encrypt an existing object in-place. Currently, you can use this API to encrypt objects in an AWS S3 object store. The assumption is that the source application passes on the object reference (detail such as the location and name). The data-protection service uses the data encryption key you provide to perform this encryption.

Protecting S3

If you are using the data-protection service to protect S3 objects, this API does the following calls:

  1. Read the object from the object store. If the object has the tag: key-signature, the Titaniam data-protection service does not encrypt the object.
  2. Perform the encryption.
  3. Write the object to the object store and applies the key-signature and X-tn-customer (if specified in the request header) tags to indicate that the object is encrypted by the Titaniam data-protection service.

This API is a synchronous call.

Quick Reference for S3 Object Store
HTTP Verb Path Description
PUT {{baseUrl}}/v1/data-protection/{store-type-name}/object Encrypt an object in-place in the object store.
S3-Related Path Parameter
Parameter Mandatory Supported Values Description
store-type-name Yes s3 Source of the object. For example, if AWS s3 is the object store, then specify s3.
S3-Related Body Parameters
Parameter Mandatory Supported Values Description
bucket Yes Any existing bucket name in the object store Specify the bucket name in the object store. Note: You cannot use a bucket that has versioning enabled.
Also, ensure that the bucket exists in s3 region. Otherwise, an error is reported.
object-key Yes Name of the object to encrypt Specify the object that you want to encrypt. Ensure that the object does not have the key-signature tag. If this tags is found, Titaniam data-protection service does not encrypt the object.
region Yes Region of the S3 bucket Specify the region of the S3 bucket.
Headers

(Optional) Specify the following header: X-tn-customer with the keyring name to use. The Titaniam service will use this key to encrypt the data.

S3-Related Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

If the operation is successful, this API returns a 200 OK response with the following response body.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.

If the API request is invalid or if the operation is interrupted, it returns a 500 Internal Server Error response. In this case, following are some of the error codes:

  • OBJECT_IDENTIFIER_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE indicates that the request object is empty.
  • S3_INVALID_BUCKET_KEY: indicates that the bucket name is invalid.
  • INVALID_STORE_TYPE_NAME indicates that the store type name you have specified is incorrect.
  • EMPTY_BUCKET_PARAM: indicates that you have not specified the bucket name in the input parameters.
  • EMPTY_OBJECT_ID_PARAM: indicates the object that you have not specified the object name.
  • S3_BUCKET_VERSIONED_ERROR: indicates that the bucket you have specified is versioned
  • UNABLE_TO_GET_S3_OBJECT: indicates that there was a technical error in retrieving the object.
Generic Response
  • EMPTY_BUCKET_PARAM: indicates that you have not specified the bucket name in the input parameters.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X PUT -H "X-tn-customer: dolore in" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -d '{
  "object-identifier": {
    "bucket": "dataprotectiontesting",
    "object-key": "sample/demo_script.pdf",
    "region": "ap-south-1"
  }
}' "{{pantherURL}}/v1/data-protection/s3/object"
PUT %7B%7BpantherURL%7D%7D/v1/data-protection/s3/object HTTP/1.1
Host: 
X-tn-customer: dolore in
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json

{
  "object-identifier": {
    "bucket": "dataprotectiontesting",
    "object-key": "sample/demo_script.pdf",
    "region": "ap-south-1"
  }
}
  • Successful operation
  • Error: PUT operation
  • Invalid request or technical issue interrupted the processing
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success"
}
Status400 Bad Request
Content-Typeapplication/json
{
    "code": "OBJECT_DOES_NOT_EXIST",
    "message": "Object - does not exist. Note: Container/Bucket Name: [no-version-data-protect], Region Name: [ap-southeast-1] and Object : [[data-clear.json]]."
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typetext/plain

Generate an URI to Download an Object from S3

Note: This API is available only if you have set sdss.data.protection.enabled=true during the Titaniam data protection service deployment.

This API generates an encoded URI or a pre-signed URL to the specified object.

If you are generating the download link to an object encrypted by Titaniam data-protection service, the response is an encoded URI to the object. This URI does not include the host information. You must construct the correct URL to get the object in this case.

If you generating the download link for object that is not encrypted by Titaniam data-protection service, the response is a fully constructed pre-signed URL.

How to know if an object is encrypted by Titaniam Data-Protection Service?

Objects encrypted by Titaniam data-protection service has the mandatory tag key-signature and optionally an X-tn-Customer tag.

Quick Reference for S3 Object Store
HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{baseUrl}}/v1/data-protection/{store-type-name}/object/link?region={region_name}&bucket={bucket_name}&object-key={object_name} Generate an encoded URI or a pre-signed URL to download an object in clear format.
S3-Related Path Parameter
Parameter Mandatory Supported Values Description
store-type-name Yes s3 Source of the object. For example, if AWS s3 is the object store, then specify s3.
S3-Related Query Parameters
Parameter Mandatory Supported Values Description
bucket Yes Any existing bucket name in the object store Specify the bucket name in the object store. Note: You cannot use a bucket that has versioning enabled.
Also, ensure that the bucket exists in s3 region. Otherwise, an error is reported.
object-key Yes Name of the object to decrypt Specify the object for which you want to generate the download URI.
region Yes Region of the S3 bucket Specify the region of the S3 bucket.
S3-Related Response

This endpoint returns the following fields in the response:

If the operation is successful, this API returns a 200 OK response with the following response body.

  • code: Specifies the response return code.
    • SUCCESS indicates that the request was successful.
  • message: Provides more information about the request. The message provides verbose information corresponding to the code.

If the API request is invalid or if the operation is interrupted, it returns a 500 Internal Server Error response. In this case, following are some of the error codes:

  • OBJECT_IDENTIFIER_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE indicates that the request object is empty.
  • S3_INVALID_BUCKET_KEY: indicates that the bucket name is invalid.
  • INVALID_STORE_TYPE_NAME indicates that the store type name you have specified is incorrect.
  • EMPTY_BUCKET_PARAM: indicates that you have not specified the bucket name in the input parameters.
  • EMPTY_OBJECT_ID_PARAM: indicates the object that you have not specified the object name.
  • S3_BUCKET_VERSIONED_ERROR: indicates that the bucket you have specified is versioned
  • UNABLE_TO_GET_S3_OBJECT: indicates that there was a technical error in retrieving the object.
Generic Response
  • EMPTY_BUCKET_PARAM: indicates that you have not specified the bucket name in the input parameters.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Accept: application/json" "{{baseUrl}}/v1/data-protection/s3/object/link?region=ap-south-1&bucket=dataprotectiontesting&object-key=sample/demo_script.pdf"
GET %7B%7BbaseUrl%7D%7D/v1/data-protection/s3/object/link?region=ap-south-1&bucket=dataprotectiontesting&object-key=sample/demo_script.pdf HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Accept: application/json
  • Successful Object Encode URI
  • SuccessfulPre-Signed URL
  • Error: Retrieval
  • Invalid request or Technical issue interrupted the processing
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "tn-proxy-path": "/v2/titaniam-s3-proxy/dataprotectiontesting/sample/demo_script.pdf!T!eyJyZWdpb24iOiJhcC1zb3V0aC0xIiwiY3VzdG9tZXIiOiJkYXRhcHJvdGVjdGlvbnRlc3RpbmciLCJ2aWV3VHlwZSI6ImNsZWFyIiwic2NoZW1hIjoiIiwic2NoZW1hVmVyc2lvbiI6IiJ9",
        "pre-signed-url": null
    }
}

Content-Typeapplication/json
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "tn-proxy-path": null,
        "pre-signed-url": "https://no-version-data-protect.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/notencrypted.txt?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20230309T120635Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=3600&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAWG3G2WLZ5LMYH2QH%2F20230309%2Fap-southeast-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=37eab80ad0839989adf4791e12543d974ecc369269d88dfd82f7dc4321015c8a"
    }
}
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
{
    "code": "EMPTY_BUCKET_PARAM",
    "message": "Bucket name is empty"
}
Status500 Internal Server Error
Content-Typetext/plain

Management Endpoints for Key Generation

The Management endpoints must be used when you are rotating keys in Vault and Elasticsearch. Vault supports full-featured search on the encrypted data. For searching through the data, Vault uses an Elasticsearch instance. When searching for data, Vault uses the default key specified in the keyring. However, before enabling search after key rotation operation, you must reindex data. The Management endpoints help you in reindexing data in Elasticsearch. For more information about how and when these endpoints are used, see the Key Rotation Reference document.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/keysha Retrieve Current Seed Store
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-schedule Schedule Reindex
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-status Verify Reindex Status
POST {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-activate Active Index

Retrieve Current Seed Store

Use this endpoint to determine the key seed store currently being used by the Titaniam Server.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/keysha

Parameters

This endpoint does not require any parameters.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • Spectra: Base64 encoded checksum value of the all keys in the Titaniam Server keyring.
  • ES: Specifies details retrieved from Titanima plugin Elasticsearch instance.
  • container : Specifies the key seed store in use. seedstore: file indicates that the keys are stored in the local filesystem. aws indicates that the keys are stored in AWS Secrets Manager. seedstore: file indicates that the key seed store details are defined in the Titaniam Key Registry Service.
  • kesha: Base64 encoded checksum value of the all keys in the Titaniam Plugin keyring.
  • build: Specifies the version number of Titaniam Plugin.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/keysha"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/keysha HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/vnd.spring-boot.actuator.v3+json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 27 Oct 2021 03:32:50 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "status": "UP",
    "components": {
        "db": {
            "status": "UP",
            "details": {
                "database": "PostgreSQL",
                "validationQuery": "isValid()"
            }
        },
        "diskSpace": {
            "status": "UP",
            "details": {
                "total": 53675536384,
                "free": 6309347328,
                "threshold": 10485760,
                "exists": true
            }
        },
        "ping": {
            "status": "UP"
        }
    }
}

Schedule Reindex

Use this endpoint to schedule a reindex in Elasticsearch. This endpoint must be used after you have added a new key to the keyring.json file in all nodes in Elasticsearch and any node that is a Vault host. This endpoint uses the keyname with the default property set to true as the new index name.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-schedule

Parameters

This endpoint does not require any parameters.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. NOT_FOUND indicates that the search terms do not exist in the data store.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the task id.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-schedule"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/reindex-schedule HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 24 Mar 2021 06:38:30 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "task": "BoLxJC\r\nXZSWGiba9ux0sKgA:166"
    }
}

Reindexing Status

Use this endpoint to determine the status of the re-indexing activity. You must use a task ID as the search query. The task ID is returned by the Schedule Reindex endpoint.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-status?task={task_id}

Query Parameters

You must pass a task ID to this endpoint.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. ERROR indicates that the ID is not found.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Lists the time it took for the reindexing, description (includes the names of the two indices, and if the reindex is complete.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-status?task=BoLxJCXZSWGiba9ux0sKgA:166"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/reindex-status?task=BoLxJCXZSWGiba9ux0sKgA:166 HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 24 Mar 2021 06:38:30 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": {
        "took": 375,
        "description": "reindex from [sdss-store-002] to\r\n[sdss-store-003][_doc]",
        "completed": true
    }
}

Activate Index

Use this endpoint to activate an index. You must use this endpoint only after ensuring that the reindexing is complete, that is, the Reindexing Status endpoint returns "completed":true in its response.

Quick Reference

HTTP verb: POST
Path: {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-activate

Parameters

This endpoint does not require any parameters.

Response

The following fields are returned in the response:

  • code: Specifies the code if the operation was successful or not. SUCCESS indicates that the operation was successful. ERROR indicates that the activation failed.
  • message
    • SUCCESS: Operation successful
  • result : Indicates a message when the operation is successful: “Activated Reindexing”.
  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/reindex-activate"
POST %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/reindex-activate HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/json
Transfer-Encodingchunked
DateWed, 24 Mar 2021 06:38:30 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
{
    "code": "SUCCESS",
    "message": "success",
    "result": "Activated Reindexing"
}

Management Endpoints for Health

The Management endpoints for health let you periodicially verify the status of the Titaniam server and Key Registry Service (KRS).

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Description
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/actuator/health Verify Titaniam Server health.
GET {{krsURL}}/actuator/health Verify KRS health

Parameters

This endpoint does not require any parameters.

Response

The following

  • status: Indicates the overall status of the service.
  • components: Indicates the overall status of the components such as the data store.
    • ping : Indicates whether the server is reachable

Retrieve Titaniam Server Health

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" "{{secureStoreURL}}/actuator/health"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/actuator/health HTTP/1.1
Host: 
Content-Type: application/json
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typeapplication/vnd.spring-boot.actuator.v3+json
Transfer-Encodingchunked

Connectionkeep-alive

    "status": "UP",
    "components": {
        "db": {
            "status": "UP",
            "details": {
                "database": "PostgreSQL",
                "validationQuery": "isValid()"
            }
        },
        "diskSpace": {
            "status": "UP",
            "details": {

                "free": 6309347328,

Management Endpoints for Product Versions

Use the following endpoints to retrieve the product version. You can use these endpoints to ensure that you are indeed using the product that you are supposed to use.

Quick Reference

HTTP Verb Path Method
GET {{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/version Retrieve the Titaniam Server product version
GET {{krsURL}}/v1/mgmt/version Retrieve the Titaniam Server product version

Parameters

This endpoint does not require any parameters.

Response

This endpoint returns 200 OK if the request is successful and also returns the product build version in the response body.

Retrieve Titaniam Server Version

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET "{{secureStoreURL}}/v1/mgmt/version"
GET %7B%7BsecureStoreURL%7D%7D/v1/mgmt/version HTTP/1.1
Host:
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length3
DateWed, 01 Feb 2023 10:15:18 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
Connectionkeep-alive
2.1.7

Retrieve KRS Product Version

  • Curl
  • HTTP
curl -X GET "{{krsURL}}/v1/mgmt/version"
GET /v1/mgmt/version HTTP/1.1
Host: {{krsURL}}
  • Response
Status200 OK
Content-Typetext/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length13
DateWed, 01 Feb 2023 10:35:48 GMT
Keep-Alivetimeout=60
